Eight golden rules for living in student dorms

It was 11 years ago that I moved into the student halls as a disinterested 19-year-old, and I still believe in fairies and moral relativism, but now I remember the fake smiles of those I annoyed - and the endless complaints about them.
Most of what I learned can be distilled into eight golden rules.
Moving back home can range from nerve-racking to completely terrifying.

The charm of the chit-chat: where you're from, whether you're a year or two over, where you stand on Corbyn, and why you're "to be honest Marmite, I neither love nor hate it because it's just yeast extract HAHAHAH I'll be in my bunk."
Take a deep breath.
And let the others have one - ask questions and show interest.
This will direct the conversation and help you distinguish people you like from those you can't talk to, even if your eyelashes catch fire and they're squirting you with a fire extinguisher.
Give people some space.
The rooms often turn into venues for alcohol receptions, movie nights, and hangouts, but they are also where people get dressed and adjust their underwear.
Related: Don't even think about starting college with a relationship
Introverts are mistreated at the university.
Your room may be your sanctuary, but many halls of residence foster a culture of hanging out in the corridors, and are a social and open to lifelong friendships.
This could be hell for someone trying to store energy.
In the culture, nothing allows you to say "I like you and want our friendship to continue, but I need some space so I can replenish the energy I spend communicating with you."
Try to sense when a friend is tired of socializing and maybe text instead of knocking on the door.
Speaking of knocking on the door: do it.
A friend of mine in the dormitory had adopted a policy that if the door was not locked, anyone was welcome to come in.
He has seen many things.
Make friends through cooking.

At the peak of the food competition craze, it will be less weird and less 1950's "welcome to the neighborhood, I baked you something, now smile as I ask you personal questions" to introduce yourself by banging on people's doors with a plate of brownies since you started college.
Offering home-made treats to people is a great way to make friends.
Your roommates may feel compelled to talk, and maybe associate your face with a sweet surprise.
To be honest, it is about you being a master chef.
A lumpy, unincorporated dough, sugar, and fat will cause people to pretend to be asleep when you knock on the door.
Stealing food is a very common crime in student dormitories.
To be honest, stealing someone's chicken is a crime, but is it stealing to take a few drops of milk for your tea?
Check the milk owner twice.
Most likely, he will tell you to fend for yourself, even if he is swimming in it.
It is very disturbing when someone steals your stuff and I understand you- but try to deal with this in a more mature way than my dormmate. She poured liquid soap on the milk to punish the thief.
He is in prison now.
Do not make noise that will keep people from sleeping or studying.
This is not just about being a good person, but because you are the einsanlar in the glass houses.
A girl in my dormitory told her neighbour to turn the bass and drums down a little bit because it was 3 a.m. and she had an exam in the morning.
The answers were to turn up the volume.
Finally, when they closed at 5 o'clock in the morning, she turned off her music, locked the door and kindly allowed them to sleep for two hours before she went to her three-hour exam.
Wouldn't it be romantic if your future spouse moved into the same corridor with you?
On the other hand, wouldn't it be weird if you misread a corridor mate as a future spouse, date and break up, and then have to see him every day, and have to watch your common friends taken hostage?
Of course, follow your heart, but if the passionate corridor neighbor is definitely not your future spouse, at least talk to him/her and advise him/her to behave.

When you find out that someone has left their keys inside the house and locked the door in a moment of merriment, know that the line between a joke and being cruel to someone is thinner than you think.
A good joke is fun but it will take time to come back.
You can give someone a valuable and fun lesson in security by hiding their possessions- but never ever mess with someone's room with shampoo and toothpaste.
Lock your doors and freeze your keys in a glass of water, but do not stick your belongings to the ceiling more than twice.

Raquel Santos (28), a mother of two who lives in Rio de Janeiro, went to an aesthetic doctor on Monday to have the laughter lines around her mouth removed.
The woman who had filler injected into her face had an increased heart rate and breathing after a while.
Later, he lost his life as a result of his heart stopping.

The oil companies are officially bankrupted.

From the year 2014, when the oil prices started to decrease, until the end of last year, about 400 billion dollars of investment was postponed, with the most deep-water oil exploration projects being put on hold.

According to research by the consultancy firm Wood Mackenzie, low oil prices have led to the delay of $380 billion in oil and gas exploration/production projects, while millions of barrels of production have also been deferred in a wide geography from the Gulf of Mexico to Africa.

The report, which points to the oil prices, which dropped to the lowest level in twelve years after it lost 70 percent value in the last 1.5 years when it was at 115 dollars in the summer of 2014, as the biggest reason for cost cuts, states "The company budgets have dramatically shrinked".
400 BILLION DOLLARS IN SUSPENSE
As crude oil prices continue to make new surprises every day, it recently fell below 30 dollars, reaching the lowest level in the last 12 years.

A research published by the energy consulting company Wood Mackenzie in these days when the discussions like "Will oil fall to $15?" and "Is oil now cheaper than water" are getting heated up, shows how the sector is affected by the falling prices.

In the last report it published in July, Wood Mackenzie showed that falling oil prices caused 46 large energy investments of $200 billion to be suspended, and in its new research, it reveals where that figure reached by the end of 2015.
According to this, 22 major projects were postponed in the last six months of 2015, and a total of 68 major projects have been postponed since the decline in oil prices began in 2014.
The value of these projects is around 400 billion dollars.
2.9 million barrels a day
The research, which highlights that the impact of the low oil prices on company plans is "cruel," notes that the most affected projects are deep-water development projects.
The suspended projects correspond to a total of 27 billion barrels of oil equivalent, while the daily production of 2.9 million barrels of oil gets postponed until 2025.
According to the research, most of the said projects postponed their final investment decision to 2017 and after, while their first production targets were moved to the years between 2020 and 2023.

The report emphasised that 170 billion dollars worth of potential investment, which is planned to be made in the next five years, is included in the 68 postponed projects, and said, "The majority of 170 billion dollars is deep sea projects."
The reason for this is that the initial investment costs are very high.
It is said that 70% of deep water spending is coming from projects in Nigeria, Angola and the US' Gulf of Mexico.
According to the research, the countries with the highest inventory of delayed oil projects are Canada, Angola, Kazakhstan, Nigeria, Norway and the United States.
These six countries have almost 90 percent of the world's proven oil reserves.
Mozambique, Australia, Malaysia and Indonesia, the countries with the largest amount of deferred gas reserves, together make up 85 percent of the total.

While most of the natural gas waiting to be tapped here lies deep below the sea, developing it requires complex and expensive solutions, such as building a liquefied natural gas (LNG) plant from scratch.

It is stated that the companies most exposed are the oil majors, with deepwater, Canadian oil sands and back-to-back commitments in the Caspian region, and it is also stated that the companies are trying to adapt to the "longer, lower" oil price scenario.
EYES IN IRAN

Not so long ago, the picture looked like this: The U.S. and Europe had imposed an embargo on Iranian oil in order to stop Tehran's nuclear program, the price of oil was around $110 a barrel and there was a discussion about how to cut Iranian oil exports without causing a sudden jump in prices.
When we return to this week, we see a completely different scenario.
Oil prices have dropped below $30 a barrel for the first time since 2004, and the main reason is an explosion of production in the US and the lifting of sanctions on Iran.
For this reason, the eyes are on Iran.
If Iran increases its oil exports, it will pump even more oil into a market that is already getting saturated.
This could also cause prices to fall below the levels that surprise us today.
Some analysts say that Saudi Arabia, which does not want to lose market share to Iran, will pump more oil and that there could be a price war between Iran and Saudi Arabia.
It is noted that once the sanctions are lifted, Iran's principal targets will be the rapidly growing oil market in Asia India and its former partners in Europe.
Iranian authorities had said in previous statements that they aimed to increase exports by 500 thousand barrels per day in the first stage and later release another amount to the market.
According to Reuters' map data, 22 very large crude carriers (VLCCs) are waiting in the Persian Gulf, and at least 13 of these are fully or largely loaded.
Iran is the holder of the world's fourth largest proven oil reserves.
Through exemptions from the sanctions, Iran is still exporting about one million barrels of crude oil per day to some countries, including Turkey.
Before the sanctions, Iran's daily oil exports had risen to as high as 3 million barrels a day.

Support Securities Research Expert Aysun Göksu answers the question of whether oil will go below 20 dollars as follows: "While concerns about global growth centered in China increase the downward pressure on commodity prices, they cause a deepening loss in oil prices."

We are seeing that oil has dropped 20% since the beginning of the year, due to concerns that the demand for oil will decrease in China, which is the largest importer of oil in the world, parallel to the economic slowdown.
In addition, due to the increase in the value of the dollar worldwide and the effect of the global excess in supply, we may witness pricing below 30 dollars per barrel in the coming days.
As long as we do not see permanent pricing above the $32-33 level, the upward movement in oil may be limited and downward pressure may increase.
At this point, it can be said that closing below the critical level of 30 dollars has a key role in the continuation of the declines.
In such a case, it should not be a surprise to see softening towards the 23.30-25.60 support band below.
Isham Sardouk: 'The angel era is over now!'
While you were assuming the role of trend creator at Victoria's Secret and WGSN, which determined the fashion trends of the world, why did you turn the course to Turkey?
- I am always up for change.
I was born in Paris, lived in London, and then went to New York.
I also held important positions there.
Meanwhile, I have been advising Koton for the last two years.
Then I saw the potential in this geography and in the Koton brand.
I realized that everything required to be a store chain in the modern world was there.
Now I am here to make it happen.
Can you do it in a short time?
- Absolutely.
Even though it is a young brand, it is already sold in 50 countries.
We produce 50 collections a year, and we have 15 different sections.
In other words, it has everything a chain of stores should have.
We are able to respond to the needs of consumers in different geographies from Dubai to Moscow.
Now we are opening a store in Paris in March, which is the beginning of a new and exciting period...
Is it a must to open a store in Paris?
- Yes.
Not because the economic situation in Europe is brilliant.
But you open some stores for the image.
You have a shop in fashion capitals like Paris and London, and you make the money from the Middle East.
One adds prestige to the brand, the other adds money, both are necessary for a brand that plays global.
So let's talk about trends...
- We have a very romantic, chic season ahead of us.
Flowing chiffon dresses, soft tones, pinks, whites, reds.
Patterns...

We are going through very difficult and ruthless times, and the fashion world always tries to bring a little bit of happiness to life by presenting chic and inspiring designs on the catwalk during these difficult times.
We do that too.
So in the new season, the "age of elegance" is back.
Let's go back to your years at Victoria's Secret.
Who was the most legendary angel? -Karolina Kurkova.
I am not just talking about her amazing physique: she is such a positive, such a good girl!
When I was working, she would sit next to me and feed me with an apple saying, "My dear, did you go hungry".
It was so sweet.
You know what I'm talking about, I researched and you have an interview with all of the Victoria's Secret models.
Wasn't Karolina beautiful?
But Adriana Lima also impressed me with her beauty.
- Yes, that voice!
That speech, that intonation...
It keeps you at a distance, saying, "Sit down and look pretty, and don't do anything else!"
It is nerve-racking.
Yes, such shocks do happen.
I had an interview with Candice Swanepoel.
She was the most beautiful girl I had ever seen, but I was horrified by her stupidity.
- Most of them are like that now.
The new angels are not like the old ones...
I remember Gisele's era...
Although it was also hard to work with him.
He went backstage and smoked like a chimney.
Not because he is a tiryaki.
No one can drink, but he can drink!
The purpose is to be a diva.
The Victoria's Secret fashion show, which aired two months ago, received the lowest rating in its history.
Why do you think so?
- As I said, the era of those legendary beautiful angels is over.
Who can do anything to Gigi Hadid?
What is nice about it?
Kendall Jenner, for example, is as skinny as a board.
No bends, no nothing.
Kate Moss has zero curves but she is the biggest name in the fashion industry.
- Yes, but how beautiful her face was.
I would like to exercise my right to object here.
I interviewed him last year, and his face was considerably downcast.
- So much smoking, drinking, now it's ugly of course.
But she had such a beautiful face in the nineties.
Her lips were like Brigitte Bardot's.
She was at the end of the supermodel era.
The era of Linda Evangelista, Naomi Campbell, Christy Turlington...
Christy was my neighbor and I saw her every morning without makeup.
There cannot be such a stand-out beauty, such a grace.
And what about Cara Delevingne?
- He is wasting himself.
Not everyone is involved in every campaign.
People are bored.
There is already no such hunger for famous models, celebrities as before.
People want to see real faces like themselves in campaigns.
We will go on this.
Because it is the trend.

Who is Bergen?
Bergen, whose real name is Belgin Sarılmışer, was born on July 16, 1960 in Mersin.
With the divorce of his parents, he moved to Ankara with his mother, Sebahat Cakir, in 1966.
After Yunus Emre Primary School in Yenimahalle, he entered the Piano Department of Ankara State Conservatory, but he left due to financial difficulties, and worked at the PTT for a while.
He accepted an offer to work after he performed at the Feyman Night Club, where he went with his friends to have fun in 1979.
Feyman performed on stage with the Grup Lokomotif Orchestra, playing a repertoire consisting of Turkish Art Music, Turkish Light Music, and arrangements in vogue at the time.
After Ankara, Bergen went to Adana for work, and she met Halis Serbes here and married him a year later.
In 1982, he released his first longplay "Şikâyetim Var" from Atlas Plak.
Bergen, who could not stand her husband's violence while her rise in the art world was continuing, ran away from her husband many times.
While she was working in Izmir in October 1982, her husband had acid thrown on her face.

Bergen, who lost only one eye and had most of her body burned in the attack, was convinced by Cengiz Özşeker, the composer of the song "Kimbilir", which made Kibariye famous after the treatment, to get on stage.

The artist, who performed in the Diamond Pavilion in Izmir, which was owned by Özşeker until 1985, prepared a demo cassette called "We Are Destiny" together with its owner and sent it to Yaşar Kekeva.
Kekeva, who liked Bergen, invited the artist to Istanbul.

The artist, who released the first professional longplay of the Istanbul music market "İnsan Severse" under the music management of Burhan Bayar, became famous with "Acıların Kadını" at the end of 1986.
The album was praised a lot and the record company awarded her with the "The Best Selling Women's Arabesque Album of 1986" Golden Record and Golden Cassette Awards in April 1987.
In the same year, he appeared in front of the camera with Yalçın Gülhan, Asuman Arsan and Meral Niron in "Acıların Kadını," a movie authored and directed by Ülkü Erakalın.
Bergen, who has a large fan base, narrowly escaped from a knife attack in Adana, where he went for a concert.

The artist, who had left the stage for a while, released the albums "Onu da Yak Tanrım", "Sevgimin Bedeli" and "İstemiyorum" with the direction of great masters Selami Şahin, Özer Şenay and Cengiz Tekin.
Bergen, who was officially divorced from her husband in April of 1989, made her comeback to the stage in June 1989 with her last album "Years Do Not Forgive."
The artist, who began promotion tours for the album, which was met with great interest, was assassinated by being shot by his ex-wife on the night of August 14-15, 1989 in Pozantı district of Adana.
He was buried in his hometown Mersin.
Bergen managed to squeeze in 5 longplay and 11 cassettes with 129 songs and a video film in his short life of 29 years.

The claims that the artist, who imprinted his signature on the arabesque with his powerful and different voice, became legendary were confirmed by the album "Giden Gençliğim" which was released after his death, being sold out on the first day.
Bergen's officially released studio albums:
1982 - Şikayetim Var LP (Reissued as MC in 1986.)
1983 - Kardeşiz Kader LP (re-released in 1985 and 1990 as MC.)
1985 - İnsan Severse LP, MC (Reissued on CD in 1999.)
1986 - The Woman of Pains LP, MC (re-released in 1999 as a CD.)
1987 - Onu da Yak Tanrım LP, MC (re-released on CD in 1999.)
1988 - The Price of My Love MC (re-released on CD in 1999.)
1988 - I don't want LP, MC (re-released on CD in 1999.)
1989 - Yıllar Affetmez (Originally the last album) MC (Re-released in 1999 as a CD.)
1990 - My Youth Gone MC (re-released on CD in 1999.)
1990 - The Suffering of the Poor Ends in the Grave MC (re-released in CD in 1999.)
1991 - My Last Cry MC, CD
Nazım Hikmet was commemorated on his 114th birthday
Nazım Hikmet Ran, who is known as the Poet of the country, was commemorated with the "Good you were born, Nazım" event in the 114th year of his birth.
The event, organized by the Konak Municipality, was held in the hall named after the poet in the Güzelyalı Cultural Center.
The event included poetry and music performances, and the famous poems of the poet were read by the theater and movie actor Rüştü Asyalı.
Also at the event, Three Anatolian Music Groups accompanied Asyalı with their interpretations.
Many art lovers joined the Nazım Hikmet event.
Among these names are Ali Seçkiner Alıcı, Erkoç Torun, Nedim Yıldız, Zeynep Göknur Yıldız and Ziya Özsökmenler.
In Istanbul, an event was organized by the Nazım Hikmet Culture and Art Foundation.
The foundation president Rutkay Aziz and the members, Nâzım Hikmet's wife Vera Tulyakova's daughter, son-in-law and grandson, actor Tarık Akan got together in Tarabya for the event.
They will read poems with the slogan like "To live like a tree, single and free / And like a forest in brotherhood" and leave carnations in the sea.
The event, which is organized with the contributions of the Sarıyer Municipality, will be accompanied by the Nâzım Hikmet Chorus.
Nazım Hikmet was born on January 15, 1902.
The poems of the world-famous poet Nazım Hikmet have been translated into more than 50 languages.
He was arrested many times because of his political ideas and spent most of his adult life in prison or exile.
His poems have been translated into more than sixty languages and his works have received many awards.
He died on June 3, 1963.
Bursa Nilüfer Municipality made special works for the 114th birthday of the world-renowned poet Nazım Hikmet.
The municipality, which is working on the documentary "Bursa's Nazım" that tells the story of Nazım's 11 years in Bursa Prison, also issued a personalized coin for the first time in Turkish history.
Thus, in cooperation with PTT, the first personal stamp was issued in the name of Nazım Hikmet in the history of Turkey.
The special coin, which costs 1.40 TL, and the first day envelopes will be presented to the guests at the event, which will be held at the Nazım Hikmet Cultural Center on Thursday, January 14.

The "3 billion euros to Turkey" crisis in the EU
The crisis continues regarding the 3 billion euros promised to Turkey for refugees.
European Commission President Jean Claude Juncker criticized Italian Prime Minister Matteo Renzi for blocking the funds to be transferred to Turkey.
Juncker says that the mood between Italy and the rest of Europe is not good, and he emphasizes that the EU has to find 3 billion Euros.
Juncker said, "This money is not for Turkey, but for Syrian refugees in Turkey."
We have not reached three million yet.
"This is a matter of the credibility of the EU, therefore it is important," he said.
Juncker said he expects the money to be completed by the previous date of January 26.
Italy is among the countries that stands out with its positive attitude when it comes to Turkey.
Diplomatic sources say Rome's stance on the financial package is not a move directly against Turkey, and is connected to problems between Italy and the European Commission and some member states.
There has been tension between Italy and the EU for some time.
Renzi had continued to criticize German Chancellor Angela Merkel and the EU in harsh terms, both at and after the last EU summit on energy, banking and migration.
Juncker, who criticized Renzi's attitude at yesterday's press conference, said, "Renzi should stop blaming the EU."
"It is wrong for Renzi, who I like much, to insult the European Commission every chance he gets," he said.
Juncker implied that Renzi was playing to the domestic audience.
One billion of the three billion Euros promised to Turkey will be covered from the EU budget.
2 billion Euros will come from the budgets of the member countries.
Germany will contribute at least 427 million euros.

I cried when I saw the Charlie Hebdo cartoon.
Speaking to the Russian official news agency Sputnik, the father Abdullah Kurdi reacted strongly and said, "To tell the truth, I cried for this cartoon."
"I felt very bad," he said.
Father Kurdi, who said that they expected positive things from Charlie Hebdo, which became a symbol of freedom of expression after the armed attack, said the following:
Unfortunately, they made a bad caricature.
Everyone was very upset about this cartoon.
Aylan was a two-year-old child and he died.
Charlie Hebdo should have shown respect to Aylan, me and my family, but it did the opposite.
This magazine should show respect to the dead children.
They published a disrespectful cartoon about our Prophet.
They even made programs about God.
It is a small thing to do to my child in front of God and the Prophet.
Kurdi, who lives in Erbil, made this call: "My call to the whole world and to the satirical magazine is that everyone should respect all children who have died."
They should not upset their families, should not add to their sorrows.
Tima Kurdi, the aunt of Aylan Kurdi who lives in Canada, was also among those who objected to the cartoon.

In the cartoon signed by Laurent 'Riss' Sourisseau, there is an implication that when he grew up, three-year-old Syrian Aylan Kurdi, whose lifeless body washed up on the shores of Bodrum, could be one of the sexual harassers in Germany.

French satirical magazine Charlie Hebdo, which was attacked by radical religious people last year for publishing caricatures of the Prophet Muhammad, is again at the center of the debate for its cartoon about Aylan Kurdi.

The cartoon, which caused different reactions on social media, is actually a part of a four-panel column.
The column reads "This is not France" and it criticizes the increasing anti-refugee sentiment along with other French values that are said to have been lost.
On the other hand, the cartoon caused many people to accuse Charlie Hebdo of racism.
Charlie Hebdo magazine also praised Germany for accepting 800 thousand refugees in a previous issue, and criticized France for its reluctance to open its doors to immigrants.
While the cartoon says "It was very close to its goal", the advertisement poster says "Two kids' menus for the price of one."

What are the benefits of steaming?
Steaming, a cooking technique that does not kill the vitamins and minerals in the food is becoming more popular.
Steaming, one of the most preferred cooking techniques in the Far East for centuries, strengthens metabolism and facilitates digestion.
This method, which also eliminates problems such as indigestion, kills bacteria and microbes in the food.
The protein, cellulose and starch in the food are fully melted by this technique, making the food softer.
Steaming, which takes place at low pressure, is done with the help of steamer pans or a steamer machine inside the pan.
In high-pressure cooking, the amount of water used and the cooking time are less.
The best example of this is the cooking in a pressure cooker.
It is necessary to wash the vegetables well, especially those that are included in diet menus, and then wait for them to be drained in a strainer.
A deep pot is filled with one-third water and a steamer is placed inside the pot.
The mouth of the pot is left half-covered.
In this way, the steam can easily escape from the pot.
The stove fire is first brought to its highest level to bring the water to the boil, and then the stove fire is brought to a lower level to obtain a constant heat.
Vegetables and foods that are cooked in steam for about 10-15 minutes are checked with a fork after they are thoroughly cooked.
The cooked vegetables are taken out of the oven and placed on plates to serve.
In the steaming cooking technique, the appearance, color and smell of the food do not change, therefore this method is healthy.
The unique taste of the food remains the same.
In this way, the quality and taste of the food is not spoiled.
In steaming, which is also one of the most economical cooking methods, food loss is also kept to a minimum.
The vegetables steamed in the pot look more lively, and they offer a satisfying feast to the consumers.
This method, which is frequently used especially in diet food, is also frequently preferred because it is light.
David Bowie - Blackstar: The Alien's "last" album
Knowing that you are going to die, making that final album without telling anyone, turning your deathbed into an artistic expression in the video clip you shot...
Such jobs may appear too "far out" for us worldlings.
I say worldlings because I am among those who truly believe that the man who did this is both immortal and extraterrestrial.
He came from another corner of the universe to our world; now he is returning to his homeland; that is all.
He came because there was an inspiration that should be given to all the world artists, not only to Kiss, Marilyn Manson or Lady Gaga.
He completed his task properly.
David Bowie, Blackstar, iTunes price: 9.99 TL 5/5
He drew inspiration from Warhol and Kubrick, who are probably from the same planet as him.
When Apollo 11 landed on the moon, he decided to say "Is this a thing? I am an alien" and he joined us by saying "Space Oddity".
Actually, he did not mix in; he always went a few steps ahead.
Many people found the way they lost thanks to him.
Both the musician and the listener...
If we put aside his interest in plastic arts and acting, it would be unfair to say that "It was only music" for his music.

His discography represents an artistic unity for me, by virtue of his lyrical journeys from song to song, and the characters he creates, his references, his originality, and his boundary-breaking tendencies.
I can neither call him the father of glam rock nor the cousin of punk...
What will happen to the jazz, which he has kept in his heart as love since his childhood, if he compares it to those avant-garde electronic movements?
David Bowie has constantly reminded us of what the word icon meant until we got used to it in these years.
It was not a man, it was not a woman; it was not a human.
They were one body.
He appeared to us for a while for a mission.
That body left this world two days after the release of his 26th studio album, Blackstar.
"Blackstar" and "Lazarus", which we listened to before the album was released, tried to get us used to where we were going.
We thought, "He is getting older, he is talking about death," but he was aware of everything.
One more game...

Except for the great "Blackstar" and "Lazarus" which carry the message and emotional weight of the album, we can say that there were four known songs: "Sue (Or In A Season Of Crime)" and "'Tis A Pity She Was A Whore", which were on the album when it was released, were re-recorded for this album.
I'd like to say that the remaining ones; "Girl Loves Me", "I Can't Give Everything Away" and "Dollar Days" are also very good songs.
Looking at the whole, "Blackstar" is built on a very strong musical structure, but it is also as sincere and made with instantaneous feelings.
Neither a death nor a "coming-to-terms with the past" album...
Just a real "final" album.
The End of a masterful music life.

A price applied throughout Turkey.

ISIS left Whatsapp, now they chat with Alrawi app
According to a new report, the terrorist organization ISIS is using its own chat app to communicate independently of chat apps such as WhatsApp and Telegram.
According to the Defense One report, the organization is using a new messaging app to communicate among themselves.
This Android application called "Alrawi" is distributed and installed through an APK file.
The application allows the organization to exchange encrypted messages and share media among themselves.
A flash move from ISIS in Iraq
According to Ghost Security Group, the app's functionality is "primitive" compared to popular apps such as WhatsApp and Telegram.
How strong the encryption used is not currently known.
Previously, ISIS had been carrying out its communications via the Telegram app, which allows all communications to be sent via encrypted links.
But Telegram had exposed channels where ISIS members were talking.
Moreover, the US administration is asking mobile application developers to put backdoors into their applications.
That's why the organization has started using its own solutions rather than relying on the encryption of WhatsApp and Telegram.

How should the semester break be spent?
We asked Murat Aydın, an education expert and student coach, how students should spend the semester break.
The semester break should not only be thought of as a time for students to rest, have fun, spend time in front of the TV or computer.
The mid-term break is an important opportunity to prepare for the new term and to review the past one.
The half-term break, called free time, is also an important opportunity for personal development, gaining knowledge, skills and hobbies.
Make a list of the semester review.
Write down and try to implement everything you do, you plan.
Be sure that you will enjoy it and have a very productive semester.
Let’s talk about how a productive semester should be for the students who are preparing for YGS-LYS.

Because the questions we receive most often from friends preparing for the YGS-LYS exams are in this direction; "How should we evaluate this period, should we solve a lot of questions or should we fix our weak points?"
Let us begin our article with advice to the friends who are preparing for the exam in order to answer these questions and to have a productive period.

The preparation process for the exam should normally start from the 9th grade, but we try to complete it mostly in the last year, which forces us to finish the last year more effectively, efficiently and to use our time more efficiently.
The final-year student has to carry out the school written work together with the exam preparation.
Even if a graduate student has taken and experienced the exam (YGS-LYS) at least once, the year that he/she prepares to take the exam again as a graduate student is still critical for him/her.
Because most graduating students and their families view the year as their last chance, and this creates even more stress.

Studying for a class is an activity that students usually do only when they are forced to or feel that they have to, and they generally leave it until the last minute, but for students who are regular and make it a habit, it has become a task and they have a plan of what to do and when to do it.
Now we have a half-term holiday in front of us and we should make the best of it.
For this, we must have a plan that will allow us to manage our time well.
Studying During the Midterm Break:
Everyone should make a plan that works for their own situation.
What has been done in the first period, what remains unfinished; you should plan the day, the week, and the 15-day time period.
There should be both subject reviews and question solutions during this period.
At the same time, students who are not lacking much can solve 1-2 practice exams.
Fix Your Weaknesses: Studies show that people forget 75 percent of what they learn within a week, 66 percent within a day and 54 percent within an hour.
The best and most effective way to eliminate forgetting is to do repetitions.
Students who make too many mistakes especially in the past should focus on general revision.
First, determine your weak areas and plan day by day, assign a topic to each day and make sure to solve them.
This planning will relax you both academically and psychologically.
Pay attention to the fact that the topics you make the most mistakes are the topics you place in your plan.
Because in the future you will not have such a long vacation period.
Do the Question Solutions:
It is as important to solve questions as it is to repeat the subject.
Because we can only see how well we understand the work we do through the feedback we get from the questions we solve.
Do not forget to set a certain number of solutions for each day.

The number of questions you solve can vary according to the amount of work you do that day; you may not be able to solve many questions on a day when you study a lot on a subject, but still, we should do a certain amount of question solving to see how much we have learned that day.
Try the Practice Tests:
Another work you should do during the half-year holidays is solving test exams.
Although not all the topics are completed, you can at least do some of the homework questions.
Let's say that you have largely completed your Turkish lesson; you can solve 40-question Turkish tests prepared.
And do time yourself while you do it.
If you can solve 40 Turkish questions in 60 minutes at first, your next goal should be to solve them in a few minutes less time if possible.
Holiday and Hobby Plan:
Of course, holidays does not only mean studying; you should spend a few days for holidays, relaxation and for your hobbies.
A holiday period spent only studying will prevent you from discharging and resting.
So you should also have time for yourself in your plans.
Reading a book, watching TV, surfing the net may be part of your plans, the most important thing is how much time you will spend on what.
I also have a small piece of advice for those friends who could not spend their first term productively.
If you say that my first term did not go very well, I did not study enough and I have many shortcomings, this semester break is also a great opportunity for you.
But first you have to decide and believe in this.
In the Turkish football super league in the 2009-2010 season, goals were scored mostly between the 76th and the 90th minutes.
Now you answer your own question, the match is over, are you going to the locker room, or is the match still going on and you have many minutes to make a goal?
I think no one wants to hear the classic comment of a defeated football team coach or players, "we are going to look to the next match now."
The only thing you should do now is to leave the past behind and walk, no, run towards the future.
To sum up what we have said:
First of all, make a semester holiday plan,
2) Go over the topics you know,
3) Take care of your unfinished business,
4) Solve the questions to reinforce the topic.
Solve the practice tests.
Read a book.
Set new goals for the new period,
Make time for yourself, your hobbies and the things you enjoy.
Make time for your family and friends.
Devote time for social and cultural activities (cinema, sports, theatre, concert, trip, picnic, etc.)
'Kervan' has set out on a long journey.

Şinasi Demirel, founder of Kervan, one of the biggest home store chains in Turkey with 45 stores, each with an average of 1,000 square meters, and his son Hasan merged Home Sweet Home, which has 17 stores abroad and 25 stores in Turkey, into Kervan.
With the operation, which also completed the commercial registry process recently, Kervan is now the owner of 17 Home Sweet Home stores abroad.
Şinasi Demirel, who said that there are still no Kervan stores abroad, said, "We will continue with big retailing with Kervan, and smaller retailing with Home Sweet Home."
He said, "The caravan will also be open to foreigners."

With a merger of Home Sweet Home, which had a turnover of 50 million lira in 2015, and Kervan, with a turnover of 90 million lira, a retail chain with a turnover of 140 million lira and production has emerged.
Kervan, which has 45 stores in 35 cities, has a total sales area of 45 thousand square meters.
Twenty-five of the stores are owned by the parent company.
There are about 500 employees in the Kervan.
Home Sweet Home has 25 stores in Turkey and 17 abroad and a total sales area of 6,500 square meters and 320 employees.

Kadir Kalaycıoğlu, Chairman of the Board of Home Sweet Home, which produces, exports and retails with his partner Alev Pakten, said that they were very happy with the merger with Kervan, and he added, "We are from Mardin, and we entered this sector in 1998."
From the beginning, we would have created a brand with the support of Şinasi Beyler.
Şinasi Bey is the TRT of this sector.
We also learned a lot from him.
In fact, we took our first step in retailing with him when he gave us Ak Merkez store.
We were already working with Kervan, not as a rival but as a strategic partner.
"Now, a very significant synergy will emerge with this merger," he said.
Kalaycıoğlu said that Home Sweet Home currently has 17 stores abroad, mostly in the Middle East, and that they also started export to China last month.
Kalaycıoğlu said, "We also opened our first corner in Shanghai."
We have an agreement with a chain of 200 stores.
"We will develop big retailing abroad as Kervan and small retailing as Home Sweet Home," he said.

The banner reading "If you do not burn, I do not burn, how will darkness turn into light" with photos of the jailed journalists Can Dündar and Erdem Gül and the banner reading "Peace" in Kurdish, Turkish and English attracted attention.

The part where Kılıçdaroğlu says that they will defend democracy to the death, whatever the cost was the most applauded part of the speech.
CHP, which has held 34 regular and 18 extraordinary congresses so far, held its 53rd Grand Congress yesterday at Ankara Arena.

A CHP executive tried to explain that it is not a bad thing by saying, "It is better than the party meetings in Korea or the Soviet Union where party members are lined up like strings and sit in silence".

While there were expressions of "The country is going wrong" on the faces and tongues, there was also a distance to the remarks of "You are going to change the course of things with the picture that will come out of this hall."

The effect of that there would be no elections in the next four years was big.
'''

He said, "We will fight to the death for democracy."
One last note; we should also remember that the CHP has solved its "organization" problem by its 53rd congress, and now it can hold congresses without problems.

iOS9: How to get the new iPhone operating system, Apple update released
To get the new operating system, go to the Settings app and touch "General" and then "Software Update".
When it is ready, your phone will offer you the option to download and install it.
Some users experienced a problem after this installation and received an error message saying "Software update failed".
Users are encouraged to wait for less traffic on the system to load or to try iTunes and try to upgrade from there.
The phone will guide you through the rest of the process.

This could mean deleting apps to make room - but Apple has prevented this by shrinking the update and offering to delete some apps, then using a special tool to reinstall them when the process is complete.
As the update proceeds, it is worth making sure that your phone is charged or that a charging device is with you so that your battery doesn't run out.
If the battery is too low, Apple will not allow the update, since the phone may stop halfway through the update.

FedEx's revenues are mixed, financial outlook for 2016 is down

FedEx reported disappointing results for the past three months, and the cargo giant lowered its profit forecast for the full year, citing a decline in demand for shipping services and higher costs in ground services.
The company also said it planned to hire about 55,000 seasonal workers for the holidays.
Around this time last year, FedEx announced that it would hire 50,000 seasonal workers for the holidays.
The market fell by about 2.5% in the pre-opening markets, 45 minutes before the opening gong on Wednesday.
FedEx Corp. said that it expects to earn $10.40 to $10.90 a share in its fiscal year ending next May, which is 20 cents less than previous estimates.
Analysts were expecting $10.84 based on a survey by FactSet.
Despite the average 4.9 percent increase in rates that will become effective on January 4, and the high surcharges on heavy or large packages that will begin in November, a decrease is likely.
According to the company, cost cuts, higher revenue and the growth in e-commerce are still expected to yield higher profits than the previous year.
Chairman and CEO Fred Smith said the company "delivered a solid performance despite particularly weak economic conditions in manufacturing and global trade."
The holiday hiring plans were announced one day after rival UPS said it planned to hire between 90,000 and 95,000 extra workers, the same number as last year.
In the three-month period ending August 31, FedEx increased its revenue by 6 percent to $692 million compared to the same period last year.
Earnings per share came in at $2.42, falling short of the $2.44 expected by 12 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research.
Income increased by 5 percent to 12.3 billion dollars.
Six analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $12.23 billion.
FedEx took a hit from a slowdown in international priority shipping last year, which caused revenue to stagnate in its Express unit.
But the explosion in online shopping boosted FedEx Ground results.
In the fourth quarter, land services revenue increased by 29% but operating income was essentially flat due to high costs in large packages and internal insurance.
While revenues in the freight division fell due to high labor costs, the express unit saw high revenues due to high base rates.
In pre-market trading, about an hour before the opening bell, FedEx shares fell $3.85 or 2.5% to $150.15.
They closed Tuesday down 11 percent for the year and 17 percent below the record high of June 11.

In one of the most widely anticipated meetings in years, Federal Reserve policymakers spent two days this week around a 27-foot Honduran mahogany table debating whether it's finally time to raise interest rates for the first time in nearly a decade.
The two-story meeting room on one wing of the central bank will feature a mural of the United States.
It is a reminder from the Fed's Chairwoman Janet L. Yellen and her colleagues that they put the nation's economic interests above all else.
The Federal Reserve has two mandates from Congress: to maximize employment in the United States and to keep prices stable.
But since the Great Depression, Fed leaders have accepted a third, unwritten mandate: financial stability.

And this third mandate, which is due to be announced on Thursday, could be the X factor in an unusually close call on whether the US economy is ready for the eventual winding down of the unprecedented stimulative support from near-zero short-term interest rates since the end of 2008.

While most data show a solid expansion of the data economy, the latest turmoil in global financial markets could make already cautious Fed officials jittery about adding vulnerability by raising the benchmark federal funds rate, even by a quarter of a percentage point or less.
"Frankly, the labor market and inflation will be the first and foremost things they'll be watching," said Lindsey M. Piegza, chief economist at brokerage firm Stifel Nicolaus & Co.
"But if they are looking for an excuse to not raise rates, the increasing uncertainty surrounding the global economy provides them with enough reason to wait a little bit longer," he said.
There is no consensus on what the Fed will do, and this is causing turmoil in the financial markets themselves.
Half of the economists surveyed by Bloomberg recently expected a rate hike this week.
Meanwhile, the financial markets are expecting the Fed to wait with its main indicator showing only a roughly 30 percent chance of a hike.
This could point to a stock market decline if policymakers do not mitigate the effect by saying another increase could be on the way if the Fed raises the rate.
On Tuesday, the Dow Jones industrial average rose 228.89 points, or 1.4 percent, to 16,599.85.
John Lonski, chief economist at Moody's Capital Markets Research Group, said, "The increase was triggered by the expectation that the Fed policy makers will keep the rate unchanged this week."
"It would be surprising if the Fed raised rates right now," he said.
If Fed officials made such a decision, they would have had to take a long year to calm the financial markets so as not to panic.
Other experts have argued that a rate increase could calm financial markets by lifting the fog of uncertainty about when the Fed will act.

Just a month ago, the Fed seemed to be on course to raise the rate by a quarter of a percentage point this month, a small step toward tightening monetary conditions that would have bolstered the U.S. recovery.
Yellen, despite complaints from liberals about the need for a more economic process, said that she expected the rate increase this year in spring and at the beginning of summer.
The rate of job creation slowed in August, but the growth in the labor market remained steady this year.
The unemployment rate fell to 5.1 percent last month, its lowest level in seven years and close to the level the Fed considers full employment.
Salary increases showed signs of improvement.
And while inflation continued to run below the central bank's 2 percent annual target, Fed officials said the sharp drop in oil prices was a significant reason.
Ian Shepherdson, chief economist at Pantheon Macroeconomics, said the economy "can cope with higher rates and needs them, despite the tightness in the labor market."
But all financial markets in the world have been shaken after the devaluation of the Chinese currency at the end of last month.
The Dow Jones Industrial average fell 16 percent below its May record high, as investors feared that a slowing Chinese economy would pull down global growth.
The market bounced back, somehow, as the Dow was down nearly 10 percent from its high in May.
Market turmoil makes it even more challenging for the Fed policy makers to decide when to raise interest rates.

Stephen D. Oliner, a senior research fellow at the UCLA Ziman Center for Real Estate and a former Fed official, said "We may have gotten a little bit narrower in this meeting, with the lack of knowledge about what's going on in the financial markets in China and the lack of news about weakening in the economy."
He now estimates they will have to wait at least another month to manage the effects better.
"There's a lot of uncertainty about the impact on the U.S. economy, and they have nearly no data on which to hang their hat on to postpone the developments in China further," Oliner said.
The health of the global economy is not one of the Fed's primary concerns, so it should not be a factor in the technical decision-making.
But in reality, the Fed became the monetary authority of the world.
The impact of central bank has been very large in recent years.
Until then, the only hint from President Ben S. Bernanke was that the Fed might be able to "taper" its worldwide market jitters-induced monetary expansion in 2013.

In a world where markets and economies are increasingly intertwined, it is reasonable to expect Fed officials not just to monitor developments elsewhere, but also to consult with other central bank officials and experts to better understand the global economy.
Zachary Karabell, global head of strategy for wealth management firm Envestnet Inc., said the decision-making process is "more of an art than a science."

Jeffrey Lacker, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond, Va., noted this month that the Fed has "overreacted in the past to financial market movements that were not connected to economic fundamentals."
Lacker, who is a voting member of the policy-setting Federal Open Market Committee and who has been pushing for a rate increase, cited the 1998-99 policy as an example.
Lacker said, "Despite the limited guidance for U.S. growth, the Asian financial crisis led the Fed to cut by three-quarters of a percentage point over three meetings."
A year later, Fed officials reversed the cuts.
Adam S. Posen, a former member of the Bank of England’s rate-setting committee, said the Fed should focus on financial stability only during major crises, such as the 2008 market meltdown.
He said the last upheaval was not close to this level.
You really don't want to be in a situation where you have to raise rates because the markets are unhappy, said Posen, head of the Peterson Institute for International Economics.
The Central Bank Law still has two authorities and does not talk about the financial balance, and I do not think that they should take any action in this regard until this changes.
Do you want a great Thai market?
Try LAX-C in the China town.
Yes, Chinatown.
The market/warehouse was opened in 1997 and belongs to LAX-C Inc.
LAX-C is a wholesale Thai market that also sells to the public, often referred to as the Thai Costco.
Yes, that is China Town, not Taiwan Town.
The Market/Warehouse is a one-stop shop for a wide range of fresh, frozen, and dried foods, popular Asian and Thai snacks, kitchenware, furniture, religious and holiday decorations.
If you want to buy motor oil, there is even an automotive section.
The shop is huge, and it can take an hour to walk through all the corridors.
If you get hungry from all this shopping, grab some food from the LAX-C BBQ Express.
The interior food section (good, inexpensive) is next to the check-out, and there are various takeout options.
What's in stock: Do you want something from Thailand?
He is probably at LAX-C.
The products are reasonably priced and some are sold in bulk.
Among the fresh products there are special Asian and regional Thai spices, fruits and more.
The meat counter is extensive, and so is the fish counter - the workers behind the counter clean and fillet the fish, and even fry it if you like.
There is a large frozen section in the store; there you can find frozen curry leaves, bitter melon, galangal, whole ducks, fish, beef blood, fish balls, regional sausages, ready-made food, and more.
Who shops there: Restaurant owners and chefs, families and individuals.
There are both shopping carts and forklifts in the wide corridors.
Fresh monthong durian stand is next to the exit stand.
Where: Between Chinatown and downtown, in the industrial part of Los Angeles, a few blocks from Philippe The Original.
Parking: LAX-C has its own parking lot, which it shares with other stores and restaurants.
Even though the mall is very crowded, it is not difficult to find a parking spot.
Brazil's Rio Grande Pediatrics Society promotes healthy nutrition during the breastfeeding period.

The Brazilian pediatrics organization SPRS has resorted to a shocking method by including milk baby pictures painted with unhealthy food depictions to try to get attention and inform mothers about the importance of healthy nutrition during breastfeeding.
Human milk is made up of many types of proteins, fats, vitamins and carbohydrates that provide all the necessary nutrients for babies to develop a healthy immune system.
Pregnant women and new mothers are advised to increase their daily calorie intake by about 500 calories due to their high energy requirements.
However, according to the new research, the food supplement that mothers should take is not limited to calorie intake.

According to a new study led by Prof. Robert Waterland of Baylor College of Medicine in Texas, healthy eating of pregnant women has protected their babies from cancer development by affecting their genetic expression.
Unfortunately, it has been determined that unhealthy eating negatively affects the child's immune system.

The final three women all think Sam Wood is the perfect man, but who will he choose?
Is the secret revealed? ...
Lana Jeavons-Fellows, Sarah Mackay and Snezana Markoski may have inadvertently revealed who will win The Bachelor.
The woman Sam Wood would choose at the end of the Bachelor program was kept a big secret.
And the other three girls are doing their best not to say who got the last rose.

But if we look at the activities of Lana Jeavons-Fellows, Sarah Mackay and Snezana Markoski before two of the three were eliminated, they may have given us a clue as to who the winner might be without even knowing it.
Sam Wood sealed his lips until the final on Thursday.

All three women detailed the reasons why Wood was perfect in lyrical terms, pointing to his sense of humor, his drive, his family values and his positive attitude as to why they would want to partner with him.
But the answers they give to the question "If it's not you, who should get the last rose?" might contain some information about who will win The Bachelor's heart.
Both Jeavons-Fellows and Markoski quickly named Mackay as the best candidate for the Wood beyond themselves.

Markoski also added, "Sarah is very practical and it is very fun to be around her."
I saw them together and there is a chemistry between them.
They feel good and comfortable when they are next to each other.
Sarah Mackay thinks she and Sam Wood will be a very good match.

"When I saw it with my friends and family, I realized this was definitely not just a game -- I am now totally hooked," he said.

Four Killed in Nepal After Police Fire Plastic Bullets at Protesters

Four people, including a 4-year-old boy, have been killed after police opened fire with plastic bullets on a crowd protesting against the proposed new constitution in the country, an official said on Wednesday.
The incident took place on Tuesday evening in the city of Rupandehi, 175 miles west of the capital, Katmandu.
District chief Bishnu Prasad Dhakal said more than 1,000 protesters had gathered outside a police station and that some threw stones and fire bombs.
Mr. Dhakal said the police had used tear gas and fired into the air before using plastic bullets.
He said that twenty police officers and five civilians were injured.
It is not clear why the plastic bullets, which are known to kill but used more often as a less lethal alternative, resulted in such a high death rate.

The clashes were the latest in weeks of violent protests across southern Nepal, where members of the Madhesi ethnic group say the proposed new constitution will dilute their political influence in the regions they live.
The ethnic Tharus group, which also wants to establish its own state, is holding protests in western Nepal.
At least 40 people, including 11 police officers, have lost their lives in the violent clashes that have been continuing since August 10.

On this date, four major political parties had agreed to divide the country into regions - an important but potentially destabilizing step toward drafting a new constitution in Nepal, which has been ruled by a central government for centuries.
The work on a new constitution had been going on since 2008, but lawmakers sped up the process after a devastating earthquake in April that killed thousands of people.
Lawmakers have been working on the draft constitution in Katmandu this week and officials said the new text would be ready by Sunday.
The NHC says there is a 60 percent chance of a hurricane in the south of Cape Verde Islands

The U.S. National Hurricane Center said Tuesday that a broad area of low pressure located about 350 miles (560 km) south of the southernmost Cape Verde Islands has a 60 percent chance of becoming a tropical cyclone within the next 48 hours.

Another well-defined low-pressure system was seen between the Cape Verde Islands and the Lesser Antilles, and the Miami-based National Hurricane Center said there was a 60 percent chance it would become a tropical storm in the next two days.
Google starts a donation matching campaign to raise 11 million dollars for refugees
Google Inc (GOOGL.O) announced a donation-matching campaign to raise $11 million for humanitarian organizations helping thousands of refugees fleeing war-torn and impoverished countries to Europe.
Google announced its charity initiative with an unexpected personal approach on its blog.
Instead of a manager making this statement, Rita Masoud, a Google employee who had escaped Kabul with her family at the age of seven, wrote about her own personal experience.
He wrote that along with hunger, thirst, cold, and fear, there were many dark bus and train journeys.
I was lucky.
But as the refugee and migrant crisis in Europe has grown, many families like mine are in need of help.

The donations will go to four non-profit organizations that help refugees and migrants: Doctors Without Borders, the International Rescue Committee, Save the Children and the UN High Commissioner for Refugees.
Google said it will match the first $5.5 million in donations at google.com/refugeerelief until it raises $11 million.

Europe is facing its worst refugee crisis since World War II, and the main reason is the civil war in Syria, which has been lasting for four years and has displaced more than four million people this year.

Weight loss surgery may help diabetes patients who are moderately obese
According to a new study, the benefits of obesity surgery in obese patients with type 2 diabetes can be seen for at least five years.
But it is still too early to say whether moderately obese diabetics live longer than those who have not undergone surgery after obesity surgery.
According to Dr. Robin Blackstone, who authored the new study on JAMA surgery and is an expert on obesity surgery, "it takes a long time for the mortality rates to manifest themselves."
Weight loss surgeries, also called bariatric surgery, use various methods to reduce the size of the stomach.
These reduce hunger and limit the body's ability to digest food.

Over the years, bariatric surgery has been proven to be effective in treating type 2 diabetes, but most of the research has been done on severely obese people with a body mass index (BMI) of 35 or higher.
BMI, which is measured as the ratio of weight to height, is considered normal when it is between 18.5 and 24.9.
A BMI of 25 or more indicates a person is overweight, while a BMI of 30 or more shows they are obese.
You can calculate your BMI from this link: 1.usa.gov/1D0ZqDv.

In the new research, researchers at Taiwan's fully-equipped Min-Sheng Hospital used data from a trial in which they compared two types of bariatric surgery - gastric bypass and sleeve gastrectomy - used to treat moderately obese individuals with type 2 diabetes since 2007.
By the end of the fifth year of the study, the average BMI of those who had surgery had dropped from 31 to 24.5.
In contrast, the BMI of those receiving non-surgical diabetes treatment remained at around 29.
Diabetes was completely resolved in 36% of the operated ones, and partially resolved in 28%.
In the group that was treated medically, diabetes was completely resolved in only 1% and partially resolved in only 2%.
Also, according to the authors, blood pressure control, triglycerides, and "bad" LDL cholesterol were generally better in the "surgically treated group."
The researchers also imaged the levels of A1c hemoglobin, which reflects the rate of blood sugar over time, in the patients.
According to the researchers, the best is to keep the A1c hemoglobin below 7 percent.
After the surgery, the A1c hemoglobin average dropped from about 9 percent to 6 percent.
In the group that received medical treatment, the rate remained around 8%.
But better "glycemic control" with the improved A1c hemoglobin levels did not reduce the mortality rate over the five years, according to Dr. Chih-Cheng Hsu and associates, who led the study.
The research team compared their findings with the two types of surgery.

In the fifth year, the group that underwent the gastric bypass operation lost more weight compared to the group that underwent the gastric sleeve operation (18.7 to 14.2 kg), a higher reduction in BMI (7.4 to 5.1), and also in A1c hemoglobin (%3.1 to %2.1) and the chances of the remission of their diabetes were higher (46.9 to 16.7).

Although the study did not show a clear benefit for survival at the end of the fifth year after surgery, Dr. Blackstone from the Arizona College of Medicine-Phoenix said there were valid data that surgery extended life span according to a study conducted among heavier patients in Sweden.

In this study the Swedish researchers found that the risk of death for obese patients who had undergone bariatric surgery was 29 percent lower than for another group that had received traditional treatment.

Although the new study did not show what the benefits were in terms of survival for surgical patients, according to Blackstone this is reassuring for those who are concerned about the issue and have a BMI below 35.
The most important part of the article is this, because it says that the surgery is safe in the group with low BMI, and there was no increase in the risk of death or renal disease, he said.
Blackstone added that people and doctors should take the weight gain issue seriously when the patient's BMI falls below 27 to 30.
I think we waited long enough for people to take this seriously, he said.
I think it is really hard to reverse the genetic changes that make their bodies prone to obesity and diabetes once they collect them in their bodies.
"It is impossible for everyone to come to Europe" - Dalai Lama - RT News
The Dalai Lama said that Europe cannot host all refugees, and added that the real solution to the current refugee crisis lies in the Middle East.
The Tibetan Buddhist leader has called for an end to violence in their countries.
The Dalai Lama mentioned the ongoing refugee crisis during his speech at the opening of the Dalai Lama Centre for Compassion at Oxford, which is the beginning of his 10-day visit to England.
He claimed that under current conditions, the interests of humanity should be put ahead of the interests of countries or continents.
At the same time, she emphasized that although appreciated, the responses of the Western European countries to the refugee crisis are insufficient in this regard.
In his speech, he said "It is impossible for everyone to come to Europe."
Although he appreciates the efforts of Germany and Austria to cope with the crisis, Dalai Lama says that these are only temporary solutions.

"It's great to deal with a few thousand refugees, but at the same time you also have to think about long-term solutions; you have to think about how you can bring durable peace and durable development to these Muslim countries, essentially through education," he emphasized.
We should think about how to reduce the deaths in our country.
We need to reduce the use of power.
"The use of force has never solved any problems," he added.

When addressing the issue of violence, the Dalai Lama also referred to what George Bush did after the 9/11 attacks and stated that the violent response of the U.S. started a chain of uncontrollable events.
In a letter I wrote to President Bush after September 11, I conveyed my condolences and indicated that the solution to the problem did not lie in violent methods.
"I know their motivation is good, but they use force and cause unexpected consequences," the Dalai Lama said.
There has been a four-fold increase in children ingesting hand sanitizers in the last four years.
Poison control centers in the United States have reported a nearly 400 percent rise in the rate of alcohol-containing hand sanitizer ingestions in children under 12 since 2010.

According to Dr. Gaylord Lopez, the director of the Georgia Poison Center, the number of cases of under-12 children swallowing hand sanitizer reported to the center increased from 3,266 in 2010 to 16,117 in 2014.
Lopez told CNN that "kids are more attracted to these types of products and unfortunately there are a percentage of them that need to be removed."
He said some children drank hand sanitizers on purpose, and some did it to impress their friends or for a social media challenge.
Videos on YouTube show teenagers drinking antiseptic for cheap intoxication.
It has been reported that some teenagers mix the antiseptic solution with mouthwashes that contain alcohol to get a harder kick.
Small children can be attracted to the enticing smell of antiseptics.
Lopez said, "The child doesn't think it is a bad thing."
Most of the ones that seem more attractive are the scented ones.
There are strawberry, grape, and orange scented hand sanitizers that are very appealing to children.
Hand sanitizers contain from 45 to 95 percent alcohol, depending on how you look at it.
Especially in small children, a few sips of alcohol can cause alcohol poisoning.
According to a statement given by Dr. Stephen Thornton, the head of the Poison Control Center at the University of Kansas Hospital, to Fox 4 TV in Kansas City, it is "high-concentrated alcohol."
You wouldn't leave a few whisky glasses lying around, but people leave these hand disinfectants lying around and it's quite an easy way for children to get a lot of alcohol.
Recently, six-year-old Nhaijah Russell was taken to the hospital for treatment after swallowing only four squirts of strawberry-scented hand sanitizer at her school.

His blood alcohol level was 0.179, or two times the legal limit considered acceptable for an adult, according to Dr. Chris Ritchey, the emergency room doctor who treated him at Gwinnett Medical Center outside Atlanta.
Nhaijah could not pronounce the words and could not walk when he came to the emergency room.

According to Rithey, the doctors kept her at a separate children's hospital overnight for observation because the alcohol caused the little girl to fall and hit her head, though there were no signs of any brain trauma.
Anne Ortoria Scott told CNN that it was "very frightening."
It could have been fatal for my child.
Lopez recommended that parents and teachers use alcohol-free products or keep contact with the skin short and place antiseptic wipes in places where children cannot reach.
It was observed that some antiseptics were associated with death cases, apart from alcohol poisoning.
In 2013, two women from Ontario died after ingesting hand sanitizer that contained an unnamed toxic substance.
Health officials had suggested that the substance could be methyl alcohol, which is fatal, not ethyl alcohol, as listed on the ingredients.
In January, three fourth-graders from upstate New York allegedly plotted to poison their "evil-hearted" teachers by placing antibacterial product around the classroom, according to police reports.
The teacher banned the use of hand sanitizer in the classroom because she is highly allergic to it.
The police characterized this plan as a "futile attempt", and recommended a disciplinary punishment for the school administration.
