Saudi Arabia did not give up on TÜBİTAK

Science, Industry and Technology Minister Fikri Işık said that a new agreement was made for the second party sale of Ballistic Image Analysis and Recognition System (BALİSTİKA) developed by Scientific and Technological Research Council of Turkey (TÜBİTAK) to Saudi Arabia, and stated that, "With the agreement covering the development and installation of 8 additional systems, the number of BALİSTİKA systems to be operated in Saudi Arabia will increase from 6 to 14."
Işık made statements about BALİSTİKA, which was developed by the TÜBİTAK Space Technologies Research Institute.

Işık explains that the system allows for ballistic examination of weapons, bullet cores, and cartridge cases seized in events, to be compared with the data in the central database, and thus eliminates the problems that ballistic experts encounter when examining cartridge cases and bullet cores.
Light said that the data obtained from different geographic locations and the accompanying information can be stored and queried together thanks to FORENSICS.

Işık, who points out that one of the most important features of BALISTİKA is its ability to obtain and display three-dimensional data with more details and less error, emphasizes that thanks to the innovations brought by the system, the ballistic expert can make decisions quickly and that the success is greatly increased.
BALİSTİKA was exported within the scope of "SUBA-1 Project".

Işık emphasized that BALLISTICA meets all of the criteria in the success metrics and received full marks from the General Directorate of Security, and noted that the system that was set-up in 10 different regions, including Ankara, covers all of Turkey.

Işık pointed out that the success of the system resulted in its export to other countries and that BALISTIKA was exported in the scope of the "SUBA-1 Project" realized with Saudi Arabia, and that its installation in 6 regions was successfully completed in 2013.

Işık said that a new agreement was made for the second party sales of BALİSTİKA to Saudi Arabia, the SUBA-2, which is the continuation of SUBA-1, was signed, and the agreement includes the development and installation of 8 additional systems, and the number of BALİSTİKA to be operated in Saudi Arabia will increase from 6 to 14.
A crocodile fossil the size of a bus was found
It was reported that the length of the prehistoric sea monster was 10 meters and its weight was 3 tons.
The length of the crocodile's skull alone was measured to be 1.6 meters.
The researchers named the species "Machimosaurus rex" and published their findings in the journal Cretaceous Research.
Federico Fanti, the lead author of the study from the University of Bologna, said the fossil, which is believed to be 130 million years old, was "almost the size of a bus."
Fanti told the Washington Post that the enormous saltwater crocodile was "at least at the top of the food chain in a certain area at that time."
Paleontologists announced that M. rex, which is thought to be the largest crocodile that lived in the sea, hunted by setting up ambushes in the lagoons.

It is thought that the biggest sweet water crocodile in history was "Sarcosuchus imperator" which lived in Africa and South America 110 million years ago and could reach to 12 meters in length and 8 tons in weight.
They are all very confused!
The first book of the writer Ece Temelkuran, 'All Women's Heads are Mixed' from 1996, was adapted for the theater by Aysa Production Theater with the same name.
The play, which stars Deniz Çakır, Zeynep Kankonde, İpek Türktan Kaynak, Kadir Çermik and Şebnem Sönmez, is directed by Selen Uçer.
This is the first play, in which Uçer, who is still acting in 'Poz' and 'Kuru Sıkı' plays, has experienced text writing and directing. The play questions the confusion in women's mind.
The play met the audience last week at Trump Show Center.
The game begins with a radio play.
A voice that takes us back to the past in the darkness.
Then the curtain opens.
A woman standing by the edge of the window, about to jump off.
Who he is and why he is trying to commit suicide is understood through the intervention of his neighbors.
LEAVING A LETTER
Ebru Uysal, played by Deniz Çakır, is a popular writer.
She was abandoned by her husband, but this is not the only reason.
There are things accumulated inside him since his childhood.
His not feeling his father’s love, being excluded in his student life, his lonely childhood, his wrong relationships, his thinking that he was not understood; these have led him to this point.
He decides to commit suicide by leaving a letter behind, but he cannot jump out of the window.

Because the talkative and naive cleaning lady 'Aysel' (Zeynep Kankonde) lives in the next apartment and she starts to talk to the mysterious woman 'Perran' (Şebnem Sönmez) who lives in the opposite apartment.
They approach the situation as if it is a normal, ordinary process.
The woman gets even more tense and cannot concentrate and jump.
When the famous singer Meltem Kaya (İpek Türktan Kaynak), who cleans their house, joins the conversation between the three, the situation gets worse.
Meltem, who approaches the situation with her own naive and sincere style, cannot help singing when she sees the crowd below.
This interesting suicide attempt takes on a different dimension when the real estate agent Murat (Kadir Çermik) enters the girl's home with the spare key.
The singer Meltem's giving false information to the press made things worse.
In the game, Nazan Öncel's song 'Sokak Kızı' is also used.
THE COMEDY OF MISERY
Uçer, who is directing for the first time, has managed to maintain the tempo and flow of the play.
Zeynep Kankonde and İpek Türktan Kaynak carry the comedy load of the play.
The caricatured characters played by the duo make the audience laugh with their facial expressions and dialogues.
While Şebnem Sönmez transfers the years of experience to the stage very well, Deniz Çakır also gives a convincing performance reflecting the depressive mood of Ebru Uysal.
Kadir Cermik, who makes a name for himself with his performance in the award-winning film 'Ivy', also accompanies these four women in a successful way.
Described as a comedy of depression, the one-act play promises to make you laugh without making your head spin.
Here are the most memorable lines that came out of Perran's mouth, played mostly by Şebnem Sönmez: Scribblers write with a fountain pen; scribblers live, they see.
All children have once thought about dying to punish their parents and for some reason they have always ended up crying in the end.
The woman is left hanging in the air, like an unfunny joke.
A woman looks for a funny story in which she always forgets the most important part.
Actually, every story begins with a kind of abandonment.
Sometimes I have to put my hands in my pockets; I cannot stand things without pockets.
The person doesn't know where to put his hands.
The more we are surprised, the more our hands multiply.
People talk behind someone's back, and they make up stories.
A misunderstanding becomes reality.
All women's heads are confused because they are confused.
Since you are unable to die, you have a chance to live.
'Consume kefir and live long'
It can be consumed safely at any age.

Nutritionist Pınar Kural Enç says that kefir, whose main ingredient is milk and which is more beneficial than milk, is one of the foods which every age group can consume safely and says, "It is more nutritious than yogurt, because it includes protein, basic minerals and B vitamins."
It is also rich in B1, B12 and K vitamins.
It forms the basis of a healthy nervous system thanks to its calcium and magnesium content.
At the same time, it is a good source of phosphorus.
Kefir, which also has a filling property, does not make you gain weight.
"It is a drink with very high nutritional value and it is easy to digest." he said.
The cure for all diseases

Pınar Kural Enç, the dietician, says that children, old people, pregnant women, and women going through menopause can consume kefir without hesitation, and "Kefir is a regional drink made in the Caucasus."
But he has now begun to make his name known to the world.
The secret of youth, kefir, which is an elixir of long and healthy life, is almost a cure for every ailment.
One of the most natural ways to keep babies away from metabolic diseases is kefir.
Friend of the intestines
This unique drink, which has countless benefits, is a friend to the intestines.
There are 1.5-2 kilograms of bacteria and fungi in our intestines.
The microorganisms in the digestive system are also divided into two groups: beneficial and harmful.
Beneficial microorganisms are called 'probiotic microorganisms'.

The activities of probiotics are as important as those of the liver, and if taken in sufficient amounts, it prevents the harmful microorganisms in the intestines from adhering to the intestinal wall and spreading.
The imbalance of the healthy microorganisms in the intestines can cause many diseases.
The health of the digestive tract should be maintained with the right nutrition.
For this, we must certainly consume probiotics in sufficient amounts.
It eliminates these problems in the intestines.
Kefir is a food that contains the most effective probiotic bacteria and the beneficial bacteria in it have a huge effect on strengthening the intestinal system.
It enables the beneficial bacteria and fungi in the intestines to multiply and be beneficial in a healthy manner.
Regular kefir use makes the intestines work, removes intestinal disorders, reduces bloating, and provides a healthier digestion.
A healthy digestive system means a healthy and disease-free body.

"Kefir is good for appetitelessness, insomnia, upper respiratory tract infections and allergies, and it also helps babies get better quality vitamins and minerals from their food, so it plays an important role in baby nutrition," she said.
Beşiktaş wants to continue from where it left off
Beşiktaş will face Mersin İdmanyurdu tomorrow in their home ground in the 18th week of the Spor Toto Super League.
The match, which will start at 20.00 at Başakşehir Fatih Terim Stadium, will be officiated by referee Mete Kalkavan.

The black and white team, which won the last four matches before the break, aims to both extend the winning streak to five matches and continue the leadership by defeating Mersin İdmanyurdu in front of its fans.

Beşiktaş completed the first half of the season with 13 wins, 2 draws and 2 losses and collected 41 points, and it entered the break at the top, just one point ahead of its closest follower Fenerbahçe.
Sun with ideal 11 on the field
Coach Şenol Güneş is expected to put his ideal 11 on the field against Mersin İdmanyurdu.

The experienced coach who faced PTT 1. Lig team 1461 Trabzon twice in the Ziraat Turkey Cup, and assigned different lineups in these matches, will return to his ideal 11 in the Mersin İdmanyurdu game.

It is expected that İsmail Köybaşı, who suffered a minor injury in the last game with the Black Sea representative, will be in the first 11, while it was learned that Güneş planned to give the shirt to Olcay Şahan in the middle.
Beşiktaş's probable 11:
Tolga Zengin, Beck, Rhodolfo, Ersan Adem Gülüm, İsmail Köybaşı, Hutchinson, Quaresma, Oğuzhan, Sosa, Olcay Şahan, Gomez.

Three Beşiktaş football players are on the brink of yellow card suspension before the Mersin İdmanyurdu match.

Mario Gomez, Luiz Rhodolfo and Andreas Beck, who have three yellow cards in the Super League, will not be able to play the match against Trabzonspor away in the 19th week if they see a yellow card against Mersin İdmanyurdu.

All eyes will be on German footballer Mario Gomez in the match between Beşiktaş and Mersin İdmanyurdu.
The 31-year-old footballer, who had scored in the last four games in which he had played with the black-and-white uniform, had risen to the top of the goal scoring race with this performance.
Gomez, who has worn the uniform in all the matches of the first half of the league and scored goals in 10 of them, has 13 goals in the league.

Meanwhile, another goal scorer for Beşiktaş, Cenk Tosun, scored three goals in the match played away against Mersin İdmanyurdu in the first half of the league and performed his first "hat-trick" in his professional career.
He won 12 out of the last 15 matches.
Beşiktaş has won 12 of its last 15 matches in the Super League.
In the league, the black-and-white team, which won one victory and one defeat in the first two weeks, won 12 of the next 15 matches, and in the other matches they got two draws and one defeat.
Beşiktaş got 6 victories, one tie, and 2 losses in 9 games played at home, collecting 19 points.
"The one who mounts and the one who eats face to face"
The Beşiktaş-Mersin İdmanyurdu match will bring together the teams that have scored and conceded the most goals in the Super League this season.
The black and whites, who scored 41 goals in the first half of the season, are the most prolific team in the league.
Mersin İdmanyurdu, which conceded 36 goals in their castle in 17 weeks, is one of the two teams that conceded the most goals with Eskişehirspor, which shared the last place on the points table.
In the first week of the season and the match that saw 7 goals, Beşiktaş defeated their rivals 5-2 on the road.
Technical director crisis in Mersin İdmanyurdu
Mersin İdmanyurdu, which could not complete the first half of the Super League at the place it wanted, also experienced a technical director crisis during the break.
On the day that the winter camp started, Mersin İdmanyurdu, who finished the first half under the leadership of Bülent Korkmaz, parted ways with the 48-year-old coach.
Hakan Kutlu, who was brought to the head of the red-whites instead of Korkmaz, was at the head of the team he had previously worked only one day.

Mersin Idmanyurdu, which held an extraordinary general assembly during the break and elected Hüseyin Çalışkan as the club president, reached an agreement with the technical director Nurullah Sağlam after the congress, but the 50-year-old trainer was also only in charge of the team for two days.
Mersin İdmanyurdu, who has not yet reached an agreement with a new name after Nurullah Sağlam, will emerge without a technical director against Beşiktaş.

Putin is licking his own vomit

While Russia is preparing to grant "status to do business with Russia" to Turkish companies in a situation in which Russia cannot replace the services provided by Turkey, the Russian Union of Tour Operators also made a statement saying "Russian citizens do not give up on Turkey".

The Russian Ministry of Economic Development, which calculated that severing the existing economic ties with Turkey would cost additional money to Russia, prepared and published a new "Exceptional Situations" draft for the Russian government regarding Turkey.
According to the draft published in the Russian Federal Register, Turkish companies and firms will be permitted to do business with Russia, even if they enter the sanction area if necessary.

According to the draft, Turkish companies and firms can benefit from products and services in cases where it is impossible to obtain them from sources outside Turkey or where local production in Russia would entail significant additional costs.

Which Turkish-origin goods and services would be included in this category will be determined by a joint commission to be established by the Russian Ministry of Economic Development in cooperation with other relevant ministries.
In this way, the bureaucrats can decide which Turkish company will be able to work with Russia by selecting them.

According to the same document, Russian state organizations and private companies will have to prove to the commission that there is no equivalence for the business they will do with Turkish partners.
If the draft is approved by the Russian government and goes into effect, privileged Turkish companies will also be registered in Russia.
The Russian Association of Tour Operators also said in a statement yesterday that Russian citizens had not given up on Turkey.

The statement included the following: "Despite the ban on tour sales and the recommendation of the Russian Ministry of Foreign Affairs not to go to Turkey, our citizens began to look for the formula to organize their holidays alone."
The number of articles on the internet social networks titled "The most practical and cheapest way to spend a holiday in Turkey" is growing like an avalanche.
The most common advice is to make hotel reservations online and to fly with Turkish Airlines.
Russian Prime Minister Dmitry Medvedev described the fall in oil prices below $30 as a "dramatic" development for Russia.
Medvedev said, "Nobody imagined that the price of oil will fall to 30 dollars, and it was a very bad surprise for our government.
He said "it seems that it will not be possible to carry out the budget with its current form".
The last month of the year 2015 that we left behind.
After the plane shooting crisis, Russian President Vladimir Putin announces that the economic sanctions will deepen.
In those days, our businessmen who were trying to go to Russia in the usual fashion and the personnel from Turkish Airlines were suffering at the border gates.
Turkish goods are being dragged through customs and subjected to unimaginable controls.
Not even a month has passed and yesterday Nerdun Hacıoğlu reports from Moscow.
One way or another, the sanctions are softening.
But why?
The reason is very simple.
In an age when the economy is so globalized, closing border gates with methods of a century ago is not your effort to turn political disputes into economic wars anymore.
Look, we are still writing news about how the economic embargo that was imposed on Iran for years was circumvented.
Russia and Turkey, two neighbors that may seem to be good friends but are not really, are actually dependent on each other.
It is technically impossible to separate these two countries, which are integrated with businessmen, tourists and entrepreneurs, and customers, in such a night.
If you close the doors, the people of these two countries will enter each other's country through the chimney.
The best thing to do is to discuss the political issues face-to-face at the table, without creating new Reza Zarabs.
Without touching the economy...

Why I Was a Witness to an Execution in Oklahoma
Today, I am going to watch a man be killed by a late legal intervention.
I hope it doesn't happen, but if it does, I will be sitting in the viewing gallery of the Oklahoma State Penitentiary's death chamber as Richard Glossip is administered a lethal injection.
He wanted me to be one of the four official witnesses to his death.
The invitation was made first through his best friend in January, and as much as I was shocked, I accepted it.
As the day approached, I began to be afraid of it.
But why am I doing this?
I agreed because I thought it was a good way to tell the whole story about the death penalty.
It will offer a unique perspective.
True, journalists are allowed to watch executions in America, and because there are more applicants than slots, there is a horrid lottery to decide who will be selected.
Oklahoma cut its media seats from 12 to five.
Whoever is chosen will watch without getting caught up in the emotions.
I can't do this.
I will sit with Richard Glossip's closest friends, and I have developed a relationship with him over phone calls and a two-and-a-half hour visit last month.
I love that man.
We laugh a lot when we talk.
The authorities in the prison said that I could not be both a witness and a journalist so they would not give me pen and paper to record what I saw.
I will try to remember all the details.
A journalist from Oklahoma accused me of compromising my impartiality via Twitter.
Here is the lesson.
Tell the prisoner's story in a way that he likes and gain access.
I complained to him.
He also acknowledged that he could have expressed that better, but he still thought what I was doing was wrong.
Richard Glossip does not agree with me about some of the things I have said and written.
He does not tell me what to write and even if he did, I would not accept it.
I told him that he could remove me from the witness list whenever he wanted.
But he wants an international journalist to be there to write about it.
If he dies, he thinks that the publicizing of his death will help the anti-death penalty movement.
A reporter from the Huffington Post, Kim Bellware, will also be with me.
If you want to learn more about this, please listen to the podcast series I prepared.
I will not retell all the details here.
I have no definite opinion that Richard Glossip is innocent.
What he did after Barry Van Treese's death is enough to make him an accomplice.
But I still believe that he is not guilty of murder.
I believe that there is absolutely no evidence to justify the death penalty.
I think that his execution was wrong.
And I will watch his death from this perspective.
I cannot claim to be truly objective.
You can look at the other reporters there for that.
The impression you will get from me will be the impression you will get from someone who watched the death of a man he liked being killed needlessly.

Robert Mugabe made a wrong speech in the parliament in Zimbabwe.
Africa's oldest leader, Mr. Mugabe, fell down the stairs when he was coming down from a podium in the beginning of the year.
He was not hurt, but the video of the incident went viral on social media.
The opening of Parliament was marred by claims that opposition MPs had received anonymous death threats if they booed President Mugabe during his speech.
Last month he was jeered and repeatedly interrupted during a speech to the nation in parliament - he repeated the speech on Tuesday.
The leader of the Movement for Democratic Change (MDC) Innocent Gonese said that seven opposition politicians received text messages during President Mugabe's speech, asking them not to disturb him.
"After Mr. Mugabe's speech, we get a message from an unknown number, but the title is 'death,'" she said.
He says that the immunity of the members are valid inside the parliament and does not work when they leave the parliament.
The spokesman said the chef was concerned about the threats against politicians from the party led by Morgan Tsvangirai.
Hewlett-Packard will cut 30,000 jobs
Hewlett-Packard will terminate 25,000 to 30,000 jobs in its corporate services unit as part of a restructuring and cost-cutting effort.
HP will split into two listed companies later this year; the company will separate its faster-growing computer and printer businesses from its hardware and services operations.
HP said in a statement that the expected layoffs will result in a charge of about $2.7 billion in the beginning of the fourth quarter.

Meg Whitman, president and CEO of HP, who will head the unit after the break up said, "these restructuring activities will create a more competitive and sustainable cost structure for the new Hewlett Packard company".
"Whitman, the Hewlett Packard company will be smaller and more focused than today's HP and we'll have a broad and deep portfolio to help companies transition to the new style of business," she said.
As a separate company, we are in a much better position to meet the evolving needs of our customers around the world.

According to a statement from the company, Hewlett Packard Company will have an annual revenue of more than $50 billion and will focus on providing "unrivaled integrated technology solutions for businesses".

The company divides its garages in Palo Alto, known as 'the birthplace of Silicon Valley, established in the 1930s by Stanford University graduates Bill Hewlett and Dave Packard, to produce electrical equipment, into two.
HP is going through a massive reorganization to cope with the transition from traditional PCs to mobile devices.

The move by HP, the world's largest PC maker and one of the biggest technology companies in the US, is one of the latest moves in the sector which reflects the belief that more focused companies perform better.
Arsenal captain Mikel Arteta says his teammates had problems after Jack Wilshere injured before the match against Dinamo Zagreb.

This is the 10th tremor to hit Zagreb this year.

"This motivation is massive," says Wenger.

In 2006 we were very close, but on the other hand I am experienced enough to be realistic.

FriendsFest: a comedy show that teaches us serious lessons about male friendship
The absence of similar portals in the programs is striking, especially in a time when men need more to open up and suicide rates are at the highest in 15 years among young men.
In 2013, it was the leading cause of death for men between the ages of 20 and 45, and it was three times higher among men than women.

To draw attention to this problem, the Campaign Against Living Miserably (CALM) declared 2015 the year of the men, and aims to challenge the culture that prevents men from asking for help when they need it.
Friendship is at the center of the struggle to accomplish this difficult task.
A study of more than 2,000 high school students with depressive symptoms, showed that the chances of recovery doubled if the person has a high number of "well-modded" friends.
Similarly, a circle of mentally healthy friends can cut the risk of developing mental problems in half for those who are not depressed.
But of course, for friendship to work, it has to be accessible.
In this age of social media-heavy communication, the focus on style rather than content and the prioritization of a quick response over meaningful communication.
Our digital lives have doubled the need to appear strong, fun-loving and successful, even if the reality is isolation.

Artificial success is measured by external values, such as money, image and social status, which dominate our minds. As a result, internal values, which have deeper impact on our mental health, such as personal development and internal longing for friendship, are consumed and lost.
As a billionaire video game creator recently revealed, money doesn't buy more happiness.
The beauty of the Friends series was that it turned this focus upside down.
The characters were defined not by their jobs but by their personalities, and they revealed this through their interactions with their friends.

Joey and Chandler's frequent hugs, the moments when they watched football in cozy armchairs, Ross' relationship with Rachel, while they were all in the background in terms of explaining the feelings of men, they were actually aware that they could relate to them.
"This is what a caring employee told me: While listening to depressed and suicidal people, I saw how even the smallest interactions among friends can make a difference."
Most of the men who contact us say they cannot talk to their friends.
The feeling of "getting by" is very strong, and the idea that opening up to others is also a sign of weakness.
One of the programs that comes to my mind when I suggest long-term coping mechanisms is the series Friends.
He highlighted the small moments of male friendship.
In the direction of my goal, a foreign status on the phone helps people in difficult situations; but long-term support comes from close personal networks of family and friends.

And if you join the FriendsFest at Comedy Central this weekend; why not take your friends to the Central Perk for a drink in this beautiful environment where the stages have been redesigned to celebrate?
Or, even better, if you see someone alone in Starbucks, smile and say hello.
You never know how your friendship will make a difference.
Friends, Comedy Central is broadcasting all 236 episodes - start to finish - for #FriendsFest.
Di Maria made it easy for PSG to beat Malmo with his goal.
Angel Di Maria celebrated with Blaise Matuidi and Edinson Cavani after scoring against Malmö.
Angel Di Maria made it easy for PSG to beat their rivals Malmo on Tuesday by scoring a goal at the beginning of the Champions League.
Here is the match report and the reactions to the match.

Paris Saint-Germain started the Champions League campaign with a confident and clear 2-0 victory against Malmo at Parc des Princes stadium on Tuesday, with Angel Di Maria and Edinson Cavani on target.

Di Maria scored the goal which ensured that the French champion continued on its way in the Champions League only four minutes before the end of the match, but they could not capitalize on their opportunities until the second goal scored by Cavani with his head in the 61st minute.

Paris, in Group A with Real Madrid and Shakhtar Donetsk, needed a strong start against the Swedish champions, not just to get out of the group stages, but to improve on their quarter-final performances in the last three championships.

But when they got the points, it was not the best game for Laurent Blanc's team, and Zlatan Ibrahimovic wasted many positions around the penalty area, and then he was taken out against the team from his home country in which he started his brilliant career in 1999.

Although I am disappointed that we did not score more than one or two goals, we wanted to win and we won.

Ibrahimovic returned to the Paris team with one of three changes in the 2-2 draw with Bordeaux in the 1st League at the weekend after the injury, but he was overshadowed in the fourth minute by Di Maria.

When the Argentine winger was transferred from Manchester United last month, he was seen as the player who would take PSG to the next level in Europe, and his beautiful shot, when he was running behind the Malmo defense after Marco Veratti's pass and shot the goalkeeper from distance, showed that those who thought this way were not wrong.
But everyone who expected PSG to win a big victory was disappointed.

Malmö, who had qualified for the tour after eliminating Celtic in the playoff, was lined up on the field with nine international players, had a five-man defense and two players in the midfield depth and was a heavy opponent.
Except for Nikola Djurdjic's shot in the 34th minute, which rattled the far post of Kevin Trapp's goal, they had very few attacks.

On the other hand, PSG gave them the chance to slow down the game with unnecessary passes and inefficient shots, in the first half Ibrahimovic could not make the finishing move in at least five attacks and in the second half, he could not keep up with Cavani's game and created disappointment.

However, he showed to be more skillful when it came to putting together his co-workers, and it was Ibrahimovic who passed the ball to Di Maria to score a false shot at Wiland's goal in the 52nd minute.
The second goal came after exactly an hour thanks to Cavani, who scored his sixth goal of the season with a header from a Maxwell cross from the left following a pass by Ibrahimovic.

The thought of Malmö returning to the game ended, and after later substitute Ezequiel Lavezzi scored a non-counted goal, Wiland saved David Luiz's shot in an empty position perfectly and did not allow the score to change.
Later Malmo coach Age Hareide admitted that PSG were a class above his own team, and the Norwegian said: "Our last Champions League match was in December last year."
Since then, I have only played in the Swedish League, which is not on the same level.
The teams in the eliminations are not enough.
Hats off to Paris.
It was a great game for them.
Glencore raised $2.5 billion from the share sales
Swiss-based mining giant Glencore took a hit from falling prices of processed goods and raised $2.5bn on Wednesday by selling shares as part of its plan to cut debts.
Glencore, listed in London, announced that it sold new shares worth 1.6 billion pounds to pay off its own debt.

The company, which has lost 57% of its market value this year, has been hit hard by falling commodity prices due to China's economic slowdown, which has caused an increase in demand and confusion in the markets.
The rights issue caused Glencore's share price to rise in early trading on the London Stock Exchange on Wednesday morning.
Shares jumped 2.77 percent to 131.60 pence as the FTSE 100 index rose 0.69 percent.
Glencore announced last week a plan to sell $2.5 billion in shares as part of a plan to reduce a $30 billion debt pile by a third.
The company sold new shares at 125 pence per share, a 2.4 percent discount to Tuesday's closing price.
He sold 1.3 billion shares, equivalent to 9.99 percent of the group.
Worries about China's slowing growth for some time cut iron ore prices roughly in half, while coal and copper and other commodities fell between 20 and 40 percent.
White House Confirms Xi Jinping's Visit to Washington
The White House confirmed on Tuesday that Chinese President Xi Jinping will make an official visit to the United States at the end of the month.
The announcement said that Xi's first official visit to Washington will take place on September 25 and that it is a return visit for Barack Obama, who visited Beijing last November.
Following the bilateral talks between the two presidents, US President and First Lady Michelle Obama will host a dinner in honor of President Xi and his wife Peng Liyuan.

The statement also emphasizes that "President Xi's visit will expand U.S.-China cooperation on regional and global issues, as well as the U.S.-China relationship, and will provide an opportunity for President Obama and President Xi to address areas of disagreement in a constructive manner."

It is expected that Xi will visit Seattle before visiting Washington, to meet with some American technology leaders, and then he will go to New York City to attend the UN General Assembly in September.

Obama and Xi are also expected to address some contentious issues, including Washington's concerns about China's alleged cyber espionage activities and China's claims of sovereignty in the South China Sea.

Professional rock climber and comedian Isaac Caldiero became the first athlete to win the $1 million prize on Monday night by conquering the American Ninja Warrior course.
This competition, which is entering its seventh season, has never seen a contestant complete all the stages of the obstacle course.
In the season finale, Caldiero and Geoff Britten managed to make it to the final round.
The last task was to climb a rope about 20 meters long in 30 seconds.

Britten became the first person to complete the course in time, and so became the first athlete to complete the notoriously tough fourth stage of the American Ninja Warrior; however, Caldiero beat him by completing the course three seconds earlier.

Xi wants to open up the economy more to the world
On Tuesday, President Xi Jinping told a group responsible for overseeing reforms that the economy needs to open up more to the outside world to speed up growth.
President said at the 16th Central Leading Group for Deepening Overall Reform that China should improve its opening-up policies by attracting foreign investment expertise.
Xi said that while encouraging opening-up, new reforms will create a new energy and vitality and provide a new space for economic growth.

The leading group adopted a series of proposals including a negative list to regulate market access, relaxation of border control policies, encouraging state-owned enterprises (SOEs) to incorporate private capital, and a review of the registration system of residents.
According to the statement, a negative list will be prepared to define the banned sectors and branches of business for investment.
The system will be tested step by step and developed with trial programs.
This is an important move, as it will give the market a greater role in allocating resources and will create a legal environment that will make the market more open.
The government will also loosen its controls on companies and allow companies to run their own affairs.
This statement also indicates that China will study new models of cross-border economic cooperation in its border areas and that new mechanisms will be put into place to promote regional growth.
More space will be opened up for private investment in order to open up sectors controlled by the state.
The statement said, "The government will not change its policy on foreign investment, and will protect the interests of foreign-funded companies and provide them with better services."
In addition, the requirements for foreigners to obtain permanent residence permits or "green cards" will be optimized, and the application processes will be simplified.
The meeting also discussed the guarantee of the right to practice law, and the training of professional judges and prosecutors.
According to a statement released after the meeting, Premier Li Keqiang and senior leaders Liu Yunshan and Zhang Gaoli also attended the meeting.
Miniature bag is now very fashionable - Zaman Newspaper Friday Supplement
In the fashion world, all roads lead to the bags.
The trend that has come to the fore lately is for the miniature ones...
It is possible to say that the small bags attached to the adults also draw attention.

I think this perspective is also valid for bags.
While I had walked the streets happily with my almost suitcase-size bag, suddenly the wind started blowing in the opposite direction and the bags started to shrink.
Small bags were already there, but this time they came in the form of smaller versions of large shoulder bags.

The trend, which started with Céline and Hermès, spread with Prada.

Loewe presents its fun bags this season in two sizes.
The panda, polar bear and elephant look-alike bags are the ones that stand out the most.
The mini versions of the big bags presented by the luxury brands with their iconic names seem to have attracted the red carpet celebrities again.
The Birkin bag, which Hermes prepared for Jane Birkin, is one of the most preferred ones.

Of course, mini bags are also prominent on the podiums.

Fendi is one of those who take the mini-bag issue to a higher level.
There is a suggestion for those who cannot fit into the mini bag but cannot give up on them.
Big bags have friend mini bags.
How?
By turning them into bag charms that can be attached to their bigger bags.
This presentation standing out on the podiums has quickly found its counterpart on the streets.
Let's see what else we will see!
Leather change in denim
Turkey is at a level to compete with the world brands in denim.
He is now enriching this experience in production with design.
Loft is one of them.

In general, zippered, short motorbike models are in fashion.
The strong air of the skin is completed by black pieces, while chiffon long blouses and shiny sweatshirts provide a sporty look.

In this sense, it is possible to say that Loft has understood its target audience correctly with its collections and complementary pieces.
A small step for Banksy, a big step for the "global"
The world premiere of the "The Art of Banksy" collection, which brings together the works of the mysterious street artist Banksy, was held in Istanbul.
The exhibition, which is the product of the artist's 15 years of work and brings together 85 original works for the first time, is the first exhibition of the Global Karaköy building.
The first exhibition of the mysterious street artist Bansky opened in Istanbul at Global Karaköy (Rıhtım Street) the other day.
The world-famous artist, who keeps his identity secret and uses a pseudonym, of course, was not at the opening.
We also do not know if he will come to Istanbul.
But according to the curator of the exhibition, Steve Lazaridas, Bansky is not even aware of the exhibition.
There is no situation that requires permission from him.
Because the way of the old friends Bansky and Lazaridas, separated after 12 years.
Some of the works exhibited are from Lazaridas' collection and some of them are collected from collectors.
But there are things that Banksy followers are curious about.
What would Banksy think about the exhibition "The Art of Banksy", which brings together 85 of his works?
How would you react to having to pay a ticket (35 TL) to enter an exhibition? What would you say if you saw the small shop that was created at the end of the 800 square meter gallery area?

Would the author of works such as The Girl With the Red Balloon, The Cleaner, and The Rose Now, which draw attention to the wounds of the world, have objected to their works being printed on tote bags and wallets and made into necklaces?
The fact that the exhibition of an artist with an anarchist soul and anonymous identity is turned into such a consumer item is a disappointment to Banksy followers.
It's not Banksy's style at all.
But you should still get your tickets before they sell out!
A small exhibition for Banksy, a big one for the globalizing world, "The Art of Banksy" can be visited until April.

TEOG results have been announced.
The results of the Transition from Elementary Education to Secondary Education (TEOG) organized by the Ministry of National Education (MEB) for the 8th grade were announced.
The results of the exam, which was held on November 25-26, were finally announced.
Weighted Common Exam Score: The scores obtained from each class included in the Common Exams are multiplied by their own weight coefficients.
The weighted average exam score is obtained by dividing the sum of the grades by the sum of the weights of the classes.
The arithmetic mean of the weighted common exam scores constitutes the weighted common exam score.
The scoring is done on a scale of 700 points.
The basis for placement is the sum of the year-end grades of 6th, 7th, and 8th grades and the weighted score of the 8th grade national exam.
The total score is divided by two and the result is the placement score.
The scoring is done on a scale of 500 full points.

'I found 26 people while looking for two wrestlers'
Mete Gümürhan's second documentary "Young Wrestlers", 66.
The first Turkish documentary to be selected for the "Generation Lplus" section of the Berlin Film Festival (February 11-21).
Gümürhan, who is originally from Edirne but who has a production company in the Netherlands, explained why and how he shot the documentary, which he completed in the summer of 2014.

The documentary "Young Wrestlers", which tells the story of a six-year-old school student from Amasya, aims to be a world champion in wrestling, will compete in the "Generation Kplus" section of the Berlin Film Festival.
Genç Pehlivanlar, the first Turkish documentary to be selected for this section, is one of the nominees for the Crystal Bear award.
Mete Gümürhan is a director who was born and raised in Holland, but originally from Edirne.
When he was a child, he listened to his grandfather's stories about oil wrestling and watched wrestling matches in Turkey, where he came during summer holidays.
"There are not just political problems in Turkey."
I wanted to tell the world what else happened in Anatolia.
He would like to come together with six directors and prepare a documentary project with the thought that, for example, wrestling, which is one of our national sports, is not well-known.
The project fails, but one day, an article in a magazine he is reading on the plane opens the door to another project for Gümürhan.
'We stayed at a sugar factory'
Mete Gümürhan follows the trace of the article talking about two young wrestler brothers who are 10-11 years old, and goes to Samsun, where the family lives.
The father of the children does not allow the filming for the documentary.
Gümürhan explains how he overcame this difficulty as follows: "I thought about what I could do all day long.
Because the Ministry of Culture could withdraw its support.
My father was talking about a boarding school in Amasya where the children would go.
I thought of going there.
I found 26 children who were interested in wrestling while I was looking for two children.
We started the preparations for shooting in a week and finished the permissions.
We didn't even have a place to stay.
"We stayed in the dormitory of the sugar factory."
The biggest difficulty for the director of the documentary, which was completed in 3 weeks, was the language.
Gümürhan says that on the set where a foreign cameraman and sound engineer were working, three different languages were spoken, "I did not know what I would face while shooting."
"They did not know Turkish either." he says.
Young Wrestlers focuses on the stories of six of the 26 child wrestlers.

Baran, who was raised by his grandfather and has a weight problem, Harun, who cannot attend the training because he broke his arm, Beytullah, who is ambitious but has health problems, Ümit, the sweetest kid at school, the youngest champion, Ahmet and Muhammed, who keeps the group together...
Mete Gümürhan describes his work with children as follows: "I let them be completely natural."
I just tried to use Muhammad everywhere.
For the first week and a half, I shot the practices.
My wish was for the children to act as if there was no camera.
"Luckily, they got used to it quickly."
It was a surprise to be selected for Berlin
Mete Gümürhan says that he did not expect Young Wrestlers to be selected for the Berlin Film Festival, "We were prepared, but it was a surprise to be selected to Berlin".
Young Wrestlers is not a sports documentary, but rather a work that tells the struggles of children and shares their lives.
"I wanted to highlight the stories of children with family problems who struggle to find their identity and overcome their problems", he says.
Support from the art world and academics

As the storm that erupted after the statement by the "Academics for Peace Initiative" went as far as opening investigations and detaining the academics, on the other hand, they are also receiving support statements one after another.
The first support came from the writers, including many famous names.
Cinematographers announced their support yesterday and actors did it the day before.

In a declaration signed by 138 theater actors, "We, as artists working in the fields of theater and performing arts, stand by the honorable meeting of academics who call for peace, and declare that we are on the side of freedom of expression, equality, the right to life and unconditional peace."
"With our conscience and all our hearts, we add our voices to the call for dialogue and peace from academics."

More than 400 filmmakers, including Deniz Türkali, Atilla Özdemiroğlu, Nadir Sarıbacak, Özcan Alper, Serra Yılmaz, Onur Ünlü, Yeşim Ustaoğlu, Pelin Esmer, Tolga Karaçelik, are standing with the free thought and art.
No buts, no ifs, no ands. "We will not be a part of this crime!"
He had supported the academics by saying "We are with you" with the "Academicians for Peace Initiative".
The Cinema Writers Association (SİYAD) also made a statement saying "We are on the side of the academics who have been targeted by the lynch campaign."

The Academics for Peace Initiative had called on the government for peace and dialogue with their simultaneous announcements in Ankara and İstanbul on January 11th and they had published a declaration titled "We are not party to this crime."

In addition to 1128 academics from 89 universities, the text was signed by such thinkers as Noam Chomsky, David Harvey, Immanuel Wallerstein, Judith Butler and Etienne Balibar, who have earned worldwide reputations with their theories and books.

President Erdoğan and Prime Minister Davutoğlu had harshly criticized the statement of the academics by characterizing it as "support for terrorism", and Erdoğan had called the institutions to take action.
Following this call, some universities fired academics, while the prosecutor's office launched an investigation.
Yesterday, many academics were taken into custody.
I am your fan, please help!
Hürrem Sultan's red hair, Beren's nose, Justin's hair...
While trying to look like celebrities is considered okay to a certain extent, it is considered a psychological disorder when it starts to affect your life.
'Celebrity worship syndrome', also known as 'celebrity worship syndrome', is a subject which has long become an academic subject in the world, and has recently started to be discussed in Turkey.
It can be considered normal to some extent for ladies to run to hairdressers with pictures of celebrities.
But we should not forget the 'Hürrem Sultan' year, when all the teenagers were walking around with red Irish hair.
It is already known that 'Beren burnu' led the aesthetic operations in the 2015 year left behind.
The situation is not much different on the men's side.
There was a time when it was cool to dress like Polat Alemdar.
Now a contrary wind is blowing and heating the area.
Justin Bieber copies flooded our environment.

So much so that the unnecessary information we quote has been read thousands of times on the internet: "First, when you go to the barber, cut the sides of your hair, that is, the sides and around the top of the ear, towards the top of your head."
Their sides will be short.
After the haircut, you should shape your hair with a little water.
After the styling process, fix your hair with a spray.
"It is necessary to shape Justin's hair when it is wet."
All of this brings to mind the 'Celebrity worship syndrome', which is already an academic topic in the world, but is just being discussed in Turkey.
Fans of celebrities are seen as a ball of love in our country.
Artists brag about their number of fans and how much they have affected them.
Fortunately, psychology does not see the situation as so simple.
In particular, it is being discussed that teenagers decide what to eat and drink, what to listen to, and what to wear based on celebrities.
Excessive attachment to unreachable role models is defined as a mental disorder.
Psychologist Sümeyye Demir accepts that Turkey is lagging behind in this field.

However, he does not overlook the fact that families are slowly becoming aware of the issue: "One of the fundamental issues of psychology is for an individual to be at peace with himself, to find peace within his own identity."
In the past, it was not taken seriously for children to fill their rooms with posters or to dress up as their idols.
This is now changing.
The parent feels the need to intervene in the situation.
"Devotion to something is a sign that something is going wrong in a young person's life."
Fans who get on the emotional speed train
Interest in celebrities is safe as long as it does not go to extremes.
Demir advises us to pay attention to such signs as not wanting to get married, being jealous of her husband, or preferring his clothing.
As the name implies, we are talking about famous people.
It is considered normal to be curious about them and be interested in their lives to a certain extent.

But according to the specialist psychologist, the young people who lose the top of the scale are in the majority: "When there are no names in the family or surroundings that represent the child in terms of virtue and good behavior, that gap is certainly filled."
Not always good examples come out.
"The child also copies the negatives."
When we ask her how we should approach them, Sümeyye Demir starts by reminding us that celebrity worship syndrome is more common in adolescence.
If we consider that teenagers may be self-confident, the problem is easier to solve.
On the one hand, we are faced with young people who complain about their families’ restrictions and on the other, expect support and compassion: "We have to consider their emotional ups and downs."
New research shows that they struggle because of changes in their brains.
"It is also natural and should be approached gently for the young person who got on the emotional speed train to be attached to one with passion."
It is possible to change behaviors
Expert psychologist Sümeyye Demir reminds us of the duties of the parents to overcome the syndrome of worshipping celebrities:
Recognize his emotional distress, be sure that you are calm before you enter the issue.
Never allow him to suppress his feelings.
Show that you respect his admiration by encouraging his independence.
Instead of teaching by scolding, be a good example and talk about role models.
Try to discuss the place of celebrities in our daily lives.
Reading books that tell about the real world of celebrities will be helpful.
Be sure to turn your communication into adult-to-adult form.
Remember that addiction and motivation use the same pathways in the brain.
Share with your child that mistakes are opportunities for change, and accept him as he is.
Be sure to get expert help on the subject of fandom.
Those who are angry and those who envy also admire
At the heart of the celebrity worship syndrome is the need to get help and assistance from others.
Unstoppable love is actually a cry for help.
But unfortunately it is not perceived that way.
Moreover, this problem is so widespread that it is not possible to confine it to a country or continent.
Dr. Recai Yahyaoğlu points out that there are certain names that occupy the television in every country.
The syndrome is more related with attachment to these famous people: "They are extraordinary."
The general majority does not have their means.
Those who have it cannot live like them.
Either because they did not accept or because they did not dare.
"But those who do not have the means, and those who have means but cannot live like them, continue to watch with envy".
Those who watch with envy or with rage are not different after all.
Both of them nurse a secret admiration for each other.
They make easy money and they are in the agenda of the magazines.
Just knowing this is enough to increase the fandom.
Another advice of specialist psychologist Sümeyye Demir is to question the reality of those lives at this point.
The artificial lives should not be overlooked.
The support of the environment for the person who is obsessed with the celebrity, comes forth here.
But the fan refuses to accept that the celebrity whom he idolizes has problems like him.

Should I have a gallbladder surgery? - Family - Health News - Zaman Newspaper
Dr. Fevzi Özgönül answers questions in his column in Meydan Gazetesi.
I have a stone in my gallbladder, and every morning when I wake up, I go to the toilet 2 or more times a day along with stomach pain after meals.
Could this also be preventing me from losing weight?
I started using alkaline now but my appetite is not decreasing, I cannot lose weight.
I have been like this since my childhood.
What should I do?
Do you think I should have a gallbladder operation?
ANSWER: Most of the time, gallbladder stones are accompanied by an infection.
These complaints of stomachache after eating are also a sign that the gallbladder contracts and releases the bile into the intestines when you eat.
The intestines that are irritated by the inflammatory bile try to get rid of the bile quickly.
This is why you go to the toilet so often.
If you go to the toilet often, what you eat is not digested and gets thrown away and you lose weight slowly.
I think you need to get this condition treated.
If you go to a specialist gastroenterologist and the situation I mentioned is detected, you can get rid of it by using antibiotics.
But eventually you may have to have gall bladder surgery.
The alkaline probiotic may reduce some of your complaints, but will not cure them.
I would continue to use alkaline probiotic no matter what.
Because the biggest help for you to lose weight is this probiotic powder.
I eat a lot when I am stressed.
When I am stressed and angry, I indulge myself in food and I gain weight.
How can I deal with this?
ANSWER: Excessive eating is actually a sign that energy needs are not being fully met.
This may be because you are eating less or skipping breakfast and lunch.
Another reason is that you cannot digest the food you eat.
For this, your digestive system needs to work properly.
If you do not have ulcer, reflux or similar problem, the easiest way is to use a good probiotic drug.
You will see the benefit of it.
I cannot gain weight, doctors do not know the reason
You usually have information about losing weight in your column.
It all sounds very logical to me, but my situation is a bit different.
I can't put on weight.
Most importantly, I don't know why.
The doctors are saying nothing.
Our techniques are not only for losing weight but for restoring the physiological function of the body and returning it to its ideal measurements.
Obesity and weakness are the same kind of disorders.
Obesity and underweight are treated with the same technique.
You will also get thinner when you eat sweets and pastries.
I think you have understood this by now.
It is possible for you to be stimulated with carboxypuncture and gain weight with healthy nutrition.
So you have moved away from your ideal body weight.
The other patients have also moved away from their ideal bodies by gaining weight.
You will reach your ideal body by gaining weight, and they will reach it by losing weight.
If the system problem is resolved, you will gain weight and they will lose weight.
But first the system needs to work properly.

A child who feels worthless gets stuck at 'hatred'
There are some feelings that are innate in the human psyche.
Fear, sadness, happiness, surprise, anger, worry...
However, feelings like hate, rancor and revenge emerge in children over time and as the result of some wrong attitudes.
Every person needs to be an individual, including in their childhood.
In other words, he wants to be respected for his decisions, to be asked for his opinion on matters that concern him, and to be made to feel that he is valued.
Ensuring these provides the basis for a healthy personality structure.

For example, making decisions on behalf of the child (what to wear, what to eat), not taking the child's wishes into account and forcing your own truths on the child (forcing a child who wants to go to football camp to go to an instrument camp) are behaviors that mean not respecting the child's personality.
A child who is not respected for his/her individuality and existence loses the freedom to be himself/herself, and his/her defense mechanism comes up with anger and hatred to protect him/her.

Psychologist Hilal Arslan says, "Because, actually, hatred and anger are the opposite of acceptance." She says that the child does not accept what has been done to him/her by hating and that she tries to explain to him/her and to the environment that s/he is valuable.

The expert psychologist says that the child's reaction is a positive development for his personality development and he says, "The hatred here is to say, 'I am here too', and it serves the purpose of protecting the child's respect for himself."
"If the child is allowed to be an individual, hate disappears", he says.
The child tries to protect his own self by taking refuge in anger and hatred.

Arslan says that the verbal and emotional violence that children are exposed to by their parents and the environment in the most vulnerable times when they are physically and mentally weak can cause negative feelings in the child, and points out that neglect makes the child feel that he is not noticed and invisible.

Arslan continues his words as follows: "This may be in the form of not meeting her emotional needs (not touching her hair, not hugging and kissing her, not taking care of her school or other needs), or not meeting her physical needs (food, drink, shelter, school needs, etc.)."
This is a nurturing attitude that opens the door to anger and hatred.
As for emotional and verbal abuse, there are behaviors such as humiliation, insults, belittling, scolding, giving unnecessary and heavy punishments, making one feel worthless, shouting.
These behaviors touch a deep place because they are directed to the child's personality.

"Either the child accepts this and loses the respect he has for himself, and spends his life struggling with the feeling of being worthless, not deserving love and being inadequate, or he seeks refuge in anger and hatred and tries to protect his own ego."

Romania is going for transparency in election spending
A new law is being prepared in Romania to identify the source of the money used in elections and to impose a ceiling on expenditures.
The government wants to make the cash donations made by individuals and companies who sponsor politicians in elections more transparent.
The draft law also foresees curbing the use of "decision money" in elections.
In the bill, each party or person needs to spend the money used in their election propaganda over a bank account.
This way, all the money spent can be controlled by the Romanian Election Commission (AEP) in a more transparent and orderly way.
Also, a cap on spending is being planned in the draft.
Keywords: Romania, election spending, transparency, Bucharest

Attacks on journalists have become commonplace in Turkey.
Before Prime Minister Davutoglu's visit to London next week, 25 famous authors have sent a letter to Prime Minister Cameron with a common signature.
PEN member writers have called on Cameron to raise the issue of press and freedom of expression in Turkey during his meeting with Davutoğlu.

Leading writers in England sent a letter to Prime Minister David Cameron, urging him to raise the issues of press and freedom of expression in Turkey during his counterpart Ahmet Davutoglu's visit to London next week.

Twenty-five writers, including the presidents of the PEN in England, Wales and Scotland, expressed their serious concerns in the letter about "unprecedented restrictions on freedom of expression in Turkey."

The writers point out that threats and physical attacks on journalists, writers and publishers have become commonplace, and they mention as examples, the attack on the Hürriyet newspaper office and the raid and seizure of the Koza İpek Media Group.

The letter signed by PEN members, including famous English writers such as Tom Stoppard, Ali Smith, Ian Rankin, and Elif Şafak, emphasizes that three journalists working for the Vice News organization were arrested, cases were opened against other journalists, and arrests of journalists continue.

The writers, who also noted that the detention of Can Dündar and Erdem Gül during the investigation phase of the MİT Trucks case raised concerns, said, "It is vital that journalists in Turkey be allowed to perform their fundamental duties in society, and inform the public without restriction or censorship."
He noted that the attacks on journalists, writers and publishers are corroding the freedoms of all of Turkish society.
He stated that the journalists and writers are exposed to intimidation methods ranging from physical attacks due to the widespread "culture of impunity".

The authors point out that the number of Turkish citizens who were charged with the crime of "insulting the president" has increased and that since Erdogan was elected in 2014, he has opened more insult cases than all of his predecessors combined.
Davutoğlu's words remained empty

It is underlined that Prime Minister Ahmet Davutoğlu, who will visit London next week, is one of the few government members who express support for press freedom, and it is indicated that these words did not turn into action.
In the letter, it is stated "Therefore, Davutoğlu's visit to London creates an important opportunity to commit clearly to freedom of expression in Turkey."
The writers called on Cameron to ensure that his government respects Turkey's obligations on freedom of expression.
The 25 writers whose signatures are on the letter:

Monica Ali, Alan Bissett, William Boyd, Chris Brookmyre, Gillian Clarke, Drew Campbell (President of Scottish PEN), Fflur Dafydd, Stevie Davies, Menna Elfyn (President of Welsh PEN), Moris Farhi, Maureen Freely (President of English PEN), Richard Gwyn, Mark Haddon, David Hare, Eva Hoffman, Hari Kunzru, Robert Minhinnick, Blake Morrison, Neel Mukherjee, Ian Rankin, Elif Şafak, Owen Sheers, Ali Smith, Tom Stoppard, Sarah Waters.
Clashes spread to all neighborhoods in Cizre, two children were killed in the courtyard of their home.
The curfew declared in the Cizre district of Şırnak on 14 December continues.
Gunshots and explosions have not stopped since the first day of the ban.
In the district, where there are sometimes very violent clashes, residents are leaving the district.
An explosive hit a house in Dağkapı neighborhood and two children, aged 11 and 12, lost their lives.
The curfew in Cizre has passed its 33rd day.
The clashes between the security forces and the PKK militants put the citizens in a difficult situation.

In the past 33 days, the residents of Nur, Cudi, Sur and Yafes neighborhoods, where the trenches are located, are leaving their neighbors while they have not received electricity and water to these neighborhoods for 33 days.
People living in neighborhoods where there are no trenches and barricades have been forced to migrate due to the clashes that occurred here.
Some citizens left the district with a white flag on their cars, and the others took their belongings and moved to the surrounding cities and towns.
While clashes continued in the neighborhoods where there were trenches and barricades, the citizens here had moved to the more central neighborhoods.
However, due to the recent conflicts in these neighborhoods, the residents were forced to move because of this as well.

In Dagkapi Mahallesi, the uncle and two children, Yusuf Akalin, 12 years old, and Busra Akalin, 11 years old, lost their lives when a grenade hit the door and shrapnel hit their bodies as they were in the courtyard of the house.
In a region in Şah neighborhood, where the population density is high, three people were injured after an explosive was thrown into a building.
Because of the expiration of the ban, the need for cash by most of the citizens increases.
In the town where all the banks and ATMs were closed, the citizens had to use their credit cards.
Citizens without a credit card are in a difficult situation.
Most of the citizens who could not meet their needs for food and medicine emigrated.
Those who remain in the district are able to survive with the help of their relatives and Cizreli philanthropists.
In the town, where only emergency cases can go to the hospital, no medical intervention can be done for those who suffer from toothache.
Education is not given in the district where schools are closed since the beginning of the large operation on December 14.
The students who were going to take the Open Education Faculty (AÖF) exam on January 16 and 17 were not able to take the exam.
The Ministry of National Education announced that the exam of the students in Silopi and Cizre will be held in Mardin.

But, students who did not want to take the exam because of the curfew in the districts, because no vehicles will go to Mardin and because the entrances to the districts are banned, did not take the exam.
There are many dead and wounded.
At least 23 people were killed and 33 injured in a bomb and gun attack on a hotel and restaurant popular with foreigners in the capital of the West African state of Burkina Faso, Ouagadougou.
126 people who were taken hostage in the operation after the armed attack were rescued.
The Minister of Security stated that three of the attackers were neutralized.
Several armed and masked assailants staged a raid on a 147-room hotel and luxury restaurant in the capital Ouagadougou on Friday evening at around 8 p.m. local time.
Five hours after the first attack, French and UN security forces stationed in the Gao state of Mali entered the operation and the first hostage rescue news came.
President Roch Marc Christian Kabore announced that at least 23 people from 18 different nations were killed and 33 people were injured in the incident.
In the operation conducted after the attack, 126 people who were taken hostage were rescued.
